text: This place rocks. Beautiful decor. Very classy yet fun vybe to the restaurant. Super clean. Great music. The fod was amazing. Peri peri sauce is insane. Service was top notch. I reccomend everyone to check this location out. Priced perfect

Eating in. Bring a parka. No seriously. This place is freezing. The food mediocre. The service, not so good. Coffee was not even made when we arrived at 6:15 PM. Salt, pepper, sauce.....etc are available at the courtesy area. Are you kidding me. It should be on the tables. They apologized for the service, because it 'got kind of busy'. What!!! Welcome to the restaurant business, you WANT to be busy. Two couples left while we were waiting and they were ordering take out. If there is a way to order ahead of time and pick it up, do that. I sincerely hope the other locations are managed better. My last time visiting this location.

I loved nandos for years then it went down hill for me.  This location has gotten me excited about Nandos again.  Fresh, good seating, nice location and good set up.  The peri peri fries are very good but I just love the chicken with hot sauce.
LOVE the chicken! One of the best I ever tasted. Didn't like the line ups (but you can't do anything about that). I would still go back, that's how good the chicken is.

Food is awesome but the service is absolute shit.  I don't know who manages this place, but it took them 45 minutes to make a chicken wrap and macho peas at 8:16 on a Friday night.  It's a shame the service is so terrible when the chicken is so good!
The chicken is good and cheap, but the staff is uninterested. Ive always tried to call in advance for pick up and and its always hold and then they eventually hang up.

4 Stars for the colourful atmosphere, friendly staff, comfortable and fun seating, and freestyle Coke machines. 3.5 Stars for the quality of the food. Four of us shared the "Familia" meal, and it was the perfect amount of food. The whole chicken was great-juicy and flavourful. The chicken skewers were mediocre- too dry. Ordering is done cafeteria style, so it was nice to just get up and go when we were done our meal. It's an overall fun experience with good food. I would definitely recommend Nando's.

Reviewed Dish: Double Leg with (Seasonal) Corn   Reviewed during: Mon - Fri Lunch time Service Speed: 3 / 5 Cooking speed: 3 / 5 Food Quality: 3.5 / 5 Food Quantity: 2 / 5 Price: 2 / 5  Cleanness: 5 / 5  Repeat: NO  We end up walking away on the first visit because the lineup was too long - You have to lineup to get a seat, then lineup again to order the food again !?  The second visit, we avoid the Fri lunch time and arrive before noon, so we got seated pretty quickly (Although the restaurant was empty, you still need to wait to be seated.....). The Double Leg is pretty tasty, but it is not significantly better than Swiss Chalet. The $3.5 corn was a disaster, it is so tasteless it taste like it was just boiled in water.......  Another time, I tried their chicken wings, it is a very small & thin wing (even with the tip and drum stick attached). It is flavorful but it is not worth $1.5 per wing.....  The place is a better location for a date than Swiss Chalet, but you want to be full, go to Swiss Chalet instead.

This was my first time to Nando's and probably my last.  I didn't realixe it was one of those places where you have to line up and order your food.  If there was a cost savings involved, I could understand it, but the food was pricy for what it was.   The quarter chicken was a leg only, my side was a small bowl of coleslaw.  I added a green tea and the bill with tax was just under $14.  For lunch.  The chicken wasn't very tender'; I had to fight to get the chicken off the bone.  It tasted no better or worse than a half dozen similar places. The coleslaw was okay if you like it creamy - I really don't.  There are many full service restaurants in the neighbourhood with more reasonable prices. I'm glad I tried it, but like I said I doubt I'll be back.

Eh nothing special, pretty much a Swiss chalet. Service is not the best and seems kind of scattered. The fries are terrible, definitely not fresh and no amount of seasoning will fix that.   They can accommodate large groups reasonably well and the prices aren't outrageous but that is about all it has going for it.

I have eaten at two different Nandos outside Central London and at one in Glasgow (Travel name drop? You bet.) Nandos in Calgary is virtually the same delicious peri peri chicken and sides along with other similar UK menu options. The decor of the 32nd Ave NE store matches those of the UK which is an open, casual dining room. There are a couple large tables for whole flocks...groups.  I usually get the extra-hot seaoned half bird, peri fries and caesar salad,  topping the grilled poultry off with a combo of extra hot and garlic sauces provided on the table. There are several levels of heat, so don't worry about burning your gizzard out! This trip (to the NE) saw three of us actually explore the menu a little more thoroughly. We discovered that there are several good platter deals for about the same money as purchasing individual meals. We were peckish, so we went with the Party Pack. For 60 clucks, err, bucks, there was enough to feed 6! Could have brought the hens, but this was a rooster's lunch!  When the food started arriving , we knew we were going to need take-away boxes! The platter of garlic bread alone was huge! 2 whole chickens, fries, rice and caesar salad! All of it was fresh and hot, with the exception of the salad - fresh but not hot (did I really need to explain that?). I like the caesar style here as they don't overload it with dressing.  The staff are plucky and helpful. Let them lead you to a table. Food arrives quickly after ordering at the counter! Servers do check on you and are happy to bring additional drinks or other things you may need to enjoy the experience.
Good food.  Crap service.   Sat waiting for my take out order for 30 min.  Order was apparently ready for a long time and they had a "communication breakdown".  Bravo.
S'good. They got chicken n whatnot. Nah mean?

First off I have to go wait to be seated, get a menu, get up go to the cash, order and pay. Then get my own drinks but when I'm paying the tip comes up....why? Secondly we order a family meal and it was a little pricey but the worst was the service and portions. Chicken was fine but I've had better. The sides that were large sized...they were small ice cream bowls. One had maybe 15 pieces of vegetables in it and the other had two small scoops of potatoes. Had to order a small salad and fries and those portions arrived in the same sized bowl that the large was in and same size! Let's put it this way...I inquired and someone came over and offered after seeing I was annoyed to give me more potatoes but the way he handled it and his approach made me not even want them. I just wanted to get out of this place and if I didn't have my family with me I would've left without eating. Over priced cafeteria that sucks
Ordered 2 chicken skewers and they were great! Tender. Nicely grilled. Good taste. Service was very friendly and fairly fast during a busy time of day (around 5 pm). I will go back.

A whole lot of hype with no substance. My significant other and I went here with a friend who had raved about this place. I've been eating Portuguese chicken my whole life, way before it was trendy (thanks Mom).   Walking into Nando's, you feel like you're in somewhat of a circus. The decor is vibrant and there's a lot going on. They don't serve you at the table. You have to go up to the counter to order. But then they serve you at the table. But you need to get your own cutlery, condiments, and drinks. I've done less running around at my cross-fit class. And the attitude here is somewhat snobby and evident that someones putting the 'fear of God' in the staff.  My chicken arrives and it's not what I expected. It's pale and just cooked. In fact, it's still pink at the center. The best part about real Portuguese chicken is the crispy skin! Look elsewhere- you won't find it here. The sides are simply okay. The hot sauce is delicious though and I regularly buy it at Loblaws for home use.  They've got custard tarts on the menu (pasteis de natas) and I order one, hoping it will make up for the lousy dinner. Well, that was the saddest looking nata I have ever seen in my life! Pale, small, no burnt top. No sooner was the tart in front of me, than I was sending it back. Well, I tried to. Our server was keen on arguing with me, telling me that if she sent the tart back, it would be waste. I remind her that I hadn't touched it, and I quickly pull up a picture on my iPhone of a proper Portuguese custard tart. She tells me in no less terms that she doesn't care and takes the tart away. Definitely an experience!

It was my first time trying out NANDOS . I was quite the pleasant experience. The chicken was juicy and tender with the unique peri peri sauce . I would come back just for the sauce ! Though it was on the pricey side but it was well worth it ! Great food and staff

This is  my second time here and I was just as satisfied as the first.  I had the Peri Peri chicken, garlic bread and the chicken liver.  The meat was tender and juicy but it was a little too charred for my liking this time. Chicken liver was very rich in texture but a little to salty.  Decor was very pretty and service is friendly.
Three words, expensive, expensive, expensive as hell. I paid almost $40.00 for 2 people to eat.  Food was adequate.

Went today with my boyfriend as we were trying to look for something a little healthier than the usual fast food options. It was my first time there but the cashier was very helpful whenever we asked questions. We settled on sharing 10 of the grilled wings with a side of corn and rice which all came to about $21. Food was very tasty and I really liked how you get the whole wing and not just the little halves. Also really enjoyed that our corn was still on the cob. I was very full after, even though we shared. The girl (different from the cashier) who brought our food said she'd return with our waters in a moment, but never came back. And you NEED water when you're having spicy food ! I had to go the counter and ask and said it slipped her mind, but there was no one else in the restaurant ... It happens. But still. Anyways. Good portions for a reasonable price for 2 people eating food that doesn't taste processed

This place was great! The chicken was perfectly cooked and a great price. I had the herb and lemon flavour since I'm not a fan of spicy. The garlic mashed potatoes and special fries were perfect sides. The added bonus was the amazing pop fountain. I recommend the raspberry coca-cola! The service was fast and interesting way of taking your order. Only downside was that their frozen yoghurt machine has been broken for quite some time and I was bummed I couldn't get any since it was bottomless!!

The chicken tastes good.  However the portion sizes are small.  If you're hungry be prepared to pay a lot.  We ordered the orange juice for my nephew and it was separated and watery.  They showed me the plastic bottle it came from and there was no expiry date. Just "expires in 1 week" printed on it.  We ordered the kids skewer meal.  The meal comes with literally just one skewer (Wolfed down by a tiny 7 yr old in 1 minute) and a very small side on a huge empty plate.  We had to order a double portion to satisfy them.  All in all it was almost $100 to feed 4 kids and 2 adults a simple, unfilling lunch. I should have gotten the family meal, perhaps that would have been more filling.  Wonder if their chickens are any more special than swiss chalet chickens.  If you compare the size of their meals, swiss chalet ' s gives 3 or 4 times more food. On the good side:   they substituted a slice of cheese cake for the chocolate frozen yogurt bc my nephew can't eat chocolate. Also the servers were very polite. Was it worth it?  Nah, I left still hungry.

I love chicken, and I love Nando's.  I remember seeing them in Vancouver in a food court (just like I've seen Swiss Chalets in some food courts), and I'm happy that they have an outlet here in Calgary.  Flame grilled chicken tastes wonderful if done right, and the various marinades and peri-peri sauces they use here really add some kick to the chicken, and not in a spicy way if that's what you want.  You pay at the till and they bring you your food to your table when it's ready if you're dining in.  If you go for the fountain pop, you can get free refills.  They also do take-out, if you're pressed for time and can only drop in for a moment.  A single meal can be somewhat expensive (depending on what your definition of 'expensive' is), but it's really great for groups where you can get a bunch of different items and sides and share.  You can experience more variety that way too while splitting the costs.  The chicken is so tender, juicy, and delicious that I always try to find an excuse to go back.  If you like chicken, you should definitely check this place out.  29/30

We find this place is very good for take-outs. Their dining room is pretty simple and I found their food tastes much better at home, as it is made for eating at home. I like their grilled chicken with lemon herb flavour. It's spicy enough but doesn't kill the taste. We usually go for their familia combo plus add some extra salads or rice and dinner for 6 is ready.   I've seen their kitchen and it's very clean, which gives me great confidence in their food. I definitely recommend them to my friends.

Where's all my chicken lovers at? If you LOVE chicken then you'll absolutely will LOVE Nando's.  Located along 32nd Street close to Sunridge Nissan and just minutes away from Sunridge Mall, you can't miss it!   The reason why Nando's deserve 5 stars all around is because they have efficient service, great customer service, great parking, quality of food, and the plating is superb.  If you haven't been to Nando's then I'll break it down for you, if not feel free to skip this part and read the next paragraph below! Basically how Nando's work is that you'll get seated at a table with a number don't forget that number because you'll need it when ordering your food. Upon receiving their menu there's a lot of choices to choose from for chicken: double leg, skewers, 1/4 chicken, 1/2 chicken, and whole. Feeling like you want more for yourself? They do have entree size with suggestive servings per person. They also have a variety of sides with two sizes, normal or Nando's size for $3 more. The plating between the two size does make a difference fyi. Once you've chosen what you want and how "hot" you want your chicken just head to the front counter and tell the cashier what you want and your table number, then from there you can grab your drinks, sauces, and cutlery and wait back at your table.  Pro tip: just ask for water and you can choose to get pop instead since you fill it up on your own plus it's bottomless. Saving yourself from that $2.75!  My girlfriend, brother and I ordered three separated dishes. The wait time wasn't that long it came in a timely matter. The food was great! Chicken was juicy, marinated and grilled to perfection and the plating was astonishing. I ordered the classic combo which consists of a whole chicken, a Nando's side and a choice of Portuguese buns or garlic bread - suggestive for two people but hey I can devour that on my own (I was a little bit hungry before hand to be honest), my brother ordered a half chicken with two separated sauces and a size of mash, while my girlfriend order a quarter chicken with Peri Peri fries. We had three different sauces for each plate, lemon & herb, hot, and extra hot. To me the hot and extra hot is the same and to be honest it's not actually hot at all.  Overall satisfied with our visit and I would strongly recommend Nando's to anyone who wants to try something new and to those chicken lovers out there. Definitely would come back again soon.

Nandos is very average grilled chicken. The sauces are what make the chicken interesting. I always get it hot and add some extra hot sauce to make it more interesting. I got a half chicken and 1 regular side for $17. It's pretty expensive for what you get. The chicken pieces were small and I was still hungry at the end. I got a side of spicy rice which was a tiny bowl spiced rice that tasted awful. I was hungry after I ate my chicken but couldn't finish the rice just because it was so bad.  Also, this isn't a fancy sit down place even though the decor is good. You order and are asked to pay (and leave a tip before you server serves you) before the food finally arrives at your table. I probably won't be going back and paying $17 for that. I would rather buy lots of chicken from the supermarket, grill it and add the nandos sauce you can buy at the supermarket.

When I visit the UK I pop into Nando's regularly and love it every time no matter what location I'm at. So I was very excited to try this location in Toronto, unfortunately it wasn't the same experience.    I ordered half a chicken with a side of regular fries and when it arrived it didn't look at all appetizing, the fries were bland and soggy and the chicken was just OK once I smothered it in hot sauce.  It's disappointing as the decor is lovely and the seating is perfect for large or small groups and the staff are friendly but I am really sad to say I won't be returning.

I always go there and the service is pretty good. I love their sauces and the food is amazing. Tonight we went and I received my chicken not well cooked. I have returned it back for them to make it well done and they did it. Please cook your chicken well.

Service is horrible, my wife suffers from low blood pressure and we asked for a table that was not directly under the A/C, we were given attitude by the staff. We will never come back here and I suggest going elsewhere to spend your money. Cashier is a little bitch.

Nando's is one of my favorite restaurants and this location is absolutely amazing. The service is great and quick and the seating is nice. The food, oh my goodness, the food. Whatever is in that peri peri sauce is magical because it tastes absolutely delicious! Their chicken sandwich is perfect if you're eating alone but if you have at least 4 people with you your best option is their party pack. You can choose the amount of heat you prefer and if there's still not enough flavor their array of sauces to choose from will definitely please your taste buds. Nando's is the perfect place to go with your friends or family to have a good meal and a good time

Great food but very bad service. The staff is very disorganized. We only ordered for take out but as we were standing there to wait for our order, we noticed that there were at least 5 people who came up with their receipts to complain about something. It seems like everyone didn't know what they were doing next and there was no work flow. I've tried Nando's in other countries and this location was such a huge disappointment. I'm never coming back to this restaurant again even if this is the only Nando's in Calgary.

Stopped in for quick bite. Very disappointed. Small overpriced portions. The grill, or, utensils need cleaning. I was seriously ill about 30 minutes after I ate there.   I was fine, immediately after I purged.   Strongly DO NOT recommend.

I tried Nando's for the first time last week. For what it's meant to be... a swiss-chalet-type portugese-style grilled chicken restaurant, I was quite impressed. The restaurant was clean and comtemporary. The service was excellent and actually well beyond my expectations.  My friend and I shared the variety pack which consisted of 1/2 chicken, 2 kebabs and 8 wings. The roast chicken was succulent and most impressive of all. It was tender and juicy! While it was as spicy as I had expected (we ordered medium), I quite enjoyed it with the garlic peri peri sauce. I found the hot peri peri sauce to be just ok.. not as flavourful as the garlic peri peri.  Back to the food... the kebabs were ok.. they weren't too dry but I much prefer the chicken pieces. The wings were decent as well. The peri peri fries were fresh and crispy. The coleslaw was ok. While the sides were just average, it was the roast chicken pieces that made the meal memorable. I'd definitely go back to Nando's over Swiss Chalet any day.  And the other nice thing is that they are licensed so you can have a beer or glass of wine with your meal.

Nando's was highly recommended to me, so of course I tried it out with my husband on a date night. Overall - We were both very confused by the higher end decor but the fast food ordering style.  Ok, whatever.  The fries were delicious.  The rest...meh.  We got the shared variety plate and honestly, I was not at all impressed by the chicken.  That's all fine, maybe it's just not my cup of tea.  However, I found a peanut in my glass of coke, my fork was dirty, and I found an eyelash in my fries, a hair in our chicken, and another hair in the chicken they brought us to replace the first chicken (definitely not our hairs, as we are both light-haired and these hairs were black).  I really wanted to like Nando's as much as everyone who has told me about it, but I won't be back.

Came here with two friends after a good gym session. We ordered two chickens and a large garlic mashed potato side. The spicy chicken was good but the mild chicken was mediocre so we had to add a lot of sauce. Service was slow. They didn't bother to give us plates and utensils so we got our own after 5 minutes because we were very hungry at that point.  We got complimentary drinks from the cashier which is pretty nice.  Not somewhere I would make a trip for.

I have been to Nando's a few times for their famous peri-peri chicken  mostly because I live close by. What it really is, is just some peri chilli sauce smothered onto  BBQ grilled chicken. The sauce is really the highlight.  While I do agree, sometimes the chicken can get dry, their side dishes are really what makes it a great meal. The peri fries is a must have for first-timer, and it has just the right amount of spices to it.  The peri rice is also good alternative, and compliments the dish well.  I usually get the fiesta meal which comes with lettuce, sour cream, salsa and rice with skewer chicken. Not bad for a quick meal.  The only drawback would be the price. A meal for 2 will run you over 20 dollars with drinks.  The restaurant runs like a fast food joint - you'll have to order at the counter and they bring it to your table, but prices don't reflect that.  Seating is generally comfortable and servers generally greet with a smile.  It's A-OK and worth to try at least once. If you like, get their bottle of marinated sauces for those summer BBQs days and make your own Peri peri chicken!

Nandos is super popular in England (used to live there; there are 300 Nandos in England therefore its an official epidemic). Nandos is mostly self-serve but the waiters bring your food, so its no big deal.   The new style is eclectic- showing design inspired from their main headquarters in South Africa mixed with bright colours and patterns. In comparison to England, the place is much more fun and lively while in England, the style is more laid back. I honestly loved how bright and airy it was on a cold February day in Toronto.   Massive amount of seating, and there is a private room in the back. It wasn't busy but it definitely has the capability to be packed.   I ordered the  "veggie sandwich"; two sides of "spiced" rice (forever called "spicy rice" in my heart) and grilled corn on the cob and bottomless coke for a total of  $15. The veggie sandwich is different than the standard soy burger you get in Toronto and it was delicious. My favorite part was this location has the most amazing range of drinks. I was freaking out to see coke cherry; coke lemon; coke lime and coke vanilla. The food tasted just as good as always and I am very happy to see a central location for Nandos in Toronto (finally!)   See photos at: http://atoronto.blogspot.com/2014/02/nandos-bay-street-to.html

This is our second time here, great service ,clean food, beautiful decoration; i feel it reflects South African style. we had half a chicken with 2 sides: corn and wedges.The second order was chicken skewers with spicy rice,it was good but small! along with coleslaw. You can choose how spicy your chicken can be.  If you like grilled chicken this is the place to be.

One of the better roasted chicken restaurants in Calgary, not that there is a whole lot of competition.  If you're asked to go to a chicken restaurant chain named after a Swiss house style, suggest Nando's instead.  The chicken is tender, but the marinade is not quite as flavorful as you might think.  This is where the selection of sauces on the table help, from lemony and herbaceous through to super hot.  A variety of healthy side dishes are available if you don't feel like fries. The only thing that stands out negatively is the Portuguese bun, with its unappealing dry texture and crust.  Three stars because I'd rather go to Joey's and order the outstanding half chicken for only slightly more money, or save some coin and pickup up a delicious hot chicken from Costco and eat at home.

This place has great chicken with just the right amount of spices and peri peri sauce. Much better than swiss chalet although much more expensive.   Family meal doesnt save you any money vs individual meals tbh.   Great selection of wedge fries, peri fries and other sides.   Would come here again.

Nando's Chicken is definitely the king of succulent, tender and juicy chicken. A healthy option for lunch or dinner. Seating does get full during lunch hours. Price wise, good quality and portions for what you pay for.   Thx for coming to Canada!

Caveat: Nigerians have a thing for Nando's! I've eaten in Nando's on 3 different continents so this review unfortunately compares the Calgary Nando's to my previous experiences.  Came to Nando's for lunch with the sis visiting from Houston. Snagged the last parking spot by the door and went in. Straight up, I liked the decor and we were greeted warmly. Grabbed seats in a booth and I ordered a Caesar salad with medium spicy chicken. Sis ordered the 1/4 chicken with spicy rice.  We both rolled our eyes when we had the chicken. Nice but not spicy by any stretch of imagination. I took off one star for the wimpy-level spicy but gotta add one star for the little touches in the decor and one more for staff attitude.

I ordered the herbal non spicy chicken leg with peas and salad. Chicken is very YUMMY, side dishes are satisdactory as well. My husband ordered the spicy chicken, slightly over burned. Service is pleasant

The food was not that good, but the service was great.  I had the plain grilled chicken leg with 3 sides; spiced rice, fries, and peri-peri vegetables. The chicken was ok, I had much better though. The peri-peri vegetables were ok also. The rice was very very bad that I couldn't eat it. I really hated it. The fries was below average.  The place itself was nice. lovely decor!
++ Halal chicken + Spacious + Beautiful decoration + Service is faster than some other Nandos that I have been to

I love Nando's . The chicken is juicy, everything is spicy, the side plates are delicious and the prices are reasonable. I ordered a half chicken with salad and rice and covered everything with their garlic sauce. The selection of sauces is excellent, they have a very unique peri-peri taste. Definitely worth checking out for fans of carribean, Mediterranean and other regions of the world that employ alot of spices. Beware of the extra-hot sauce!

We ate there for the first time last week, but surely will return.  The chicken was delicious!  You order at the counter, but they serve you at your table.  The portions were relatively small so order generously.  The staff was friendly and helpful and service was pretty quick.  I also liked that they played Portuguese music.  It's not the kind of place where you sit for fine dining -- it's fast food, but really tasty.  If you like spicy food, their peri-peri sauce is up your alley, but if you don't, you can get lemon and herb.

I tried it because i was craving portuguese style chicken and read the reviews. Thought id try it myself. I feel like the chicken they give u is too skinny. The flavour is good but not enough meat. Its great for someone who eats a little bit and eats lights. However it felt too expensive for the price. 2 drinks one chicke  with two sides and another chicken combo with one side came up to 30bucks!! I felt like. Wow.. really 15 bucks for this tiny bit of chicken? Althought u dont get alot i would still go cause the flavour was good and if i dont wanna go all the way to maple to get  delicious pollio loco. Anywas thats my opinion. It was good. But they were just stingy on the portions. Service was great though.

Every time I get food here (usually about once a week), it's always the Fiesta Meal. Chicken breast, rice, salad (chopped Romaine lettuce and diced tomatoes) and it comes with a light spring dressing and sour cream for the chicken and rice. I usually get the spice level hot but G prefers his a combination of medium/hot. Like one reviewer mentioned, it does continue to burn after. :)  It's kind of interesting to note that they get you to pay for the meal before you sit down with your number at a table and there's an option to tip on the machine (if you're paying by any kind of card). Not quite sure why they have it set up this way... how do I know what I'm going to tip if they haven't served me the food yet??   All of that being said, their service is decent so I don't have issues leaving a pre-tip. (Oh, but on that note, why the heck is tip calculated as a percentage of the meal??? In my books, service is service, regardless of how expensive the meal is. I wish the practice of tipping with set dollar amounts would take hold vs a percentage of the meal. Would you tip a valet more or less depending on the venue or the cost of your meal? Ridiculous.)  But I digress, the food at Nando's is good, the dining experience: casual and the spice levels: hot, hot, hot!
Chicken is pretty good but service is poor and check your take out before you leave because they messed up my order 3 out of 5 times before I stopped buying from them.
Overall, I'm not a big fan.  Pros: - decent chicken - good selection of sauces to choose from and combine  Cons: - long wait times for lunch - small portions - the menu could be bigger

Not my kind of place...having to pay up front before one experiences the no-service policy...carrying ones glass of wine & water to the assigned table....having to pick up napkin,cutlery & ketchup en-route...noise level (not a place for a meal & conversation) spicy fries (regular ones with a spice powder sprinkled on top as an after thought) Chicken was fine...but back to Swiss Chalet (while not perfect) when next I am looking for this type of chicken-fix

Nando's can't decide what it wants to be. Part cafeteria, part fast food, part sit-down restaurant, Nando's offers cafeteria-quality food at restaurant prices served in a fast-food atmosphere. The service was quite poor - parts of our order were forgotten, and we had to ask not once but twice to get it. Since they have no servers (remember, it is only part-restaurant) we had to get up ourselves each time. But since everything is in the back (remember, it is part-restaurant) we couldn't get it ourselves - we were told to sit down and wait.   The portions were small, especially for restaurant prices. They charge $6.50 for a "large" plate of French Fries - they don't stack them on the plate, so it's a flat plate of cheap McCain fries (or similar) for that price. They could at least serve fries made in-house.   The chicken is fine, competently cooked, but at $17 for a whole chicken I expect more than that. The wraps and sandwiches are $6-7 for a small piece of chicken. There is nothing special - they take some lettuce and sauce, add a small bit of chicken and slap it in a wrap/bun.   Overall, this was a very disappointing experience. It reminded me of my high school cafeteria, but it cost 2x as much.

I'm a ducky straight out of South Africa, and breast fed on Nandos! Ive tried this place twice, yup the taste is pretty much the same but, i cant get over how small and shrunken the portions are. I have never seen chicken in T.O which was so itsy bitsy. The chicken is packed with flavour but is so disappointing seeing such anorexic portions. I over heard a customer in the washroom complaining that she had to send her portion of fries back- 10 fries doesn't cut a portion!  They could do so much better.

Really liked the decor and the seating, quite inspirational.   Service was anything but - me and 3 others got seated and were informed of how it all works, but we never heard from that server again. After we received our food from a different server, we wanted to refill our water, but none of the servers came by our way. One did walk by, but when we directed "excuse me" to her, she pointedly ignored us and continued walking away. It took us 10 minutes to get some water (and it was a really hot day, so you can't blame us).   Food wise, I got the chicken liver, while the others got the chicken breast and chicken sandwich. It was good but not mind-blowingly amazing. I've had better chicken. I liked the peri peri (sp?) system, and the rice and fries were well done.
They can do better than this. Nandos is known for good grilled chicken around the world. Not at this location. Do better
Delicious food and fast service! Always a fun evening here.

Nando's is pretty popular in Australia, which is why I got so excited to find there's one in Toronto. Sadly the two things I love most about the Aussie Nando's don't seem to exist in it's Canadian counterpart - the BBQ chicken ribs, and the chicken seasoning on the fries.  The prices here are more expensive than in Australia, which I can't really justify.  I was a bit disappointed for the above reasons. My partner loved the whole meal though, and wouldn't blink at the expense to go again.

I love the Nando's in London so when it came to Toronto I was super excited.   The sauce or is it the chicken tastes different ?! The vegetables feel a little too greasy. The fries not enough of the dry rub spice. Mashed potatoes are super garlic.  The caesar chicken sandwich is definitely one of my favorites.. a great balance of spicy and tangy. Also love that they give you extra sauces to try out when you order take away.   They ask you to tip before even providing any service. If I had known they were going to take 45min to serve lukewarm food I definitely would have not tipped.   Nando's on Bay needs to step it up.

One of my favorite restaurants. Its an nice place to go to in general. It's like a fast food place with the premium environment of a restaurant, which is pretty cool. The noise level seemed to be low which is also a good perk. I go there occasionally, like after exams, usually with my schoolmates.   The food: Simply amazing.  One of the best grilled chicken my taste-buds ever tasted. I usually order a half-chicken plate with fries and drink. Everything starting from the texture of the meat to the flavor is excellent. The food is prepared fresh so the meat is quite tender and juicy. One of the most noteworthy things about the restaurant is the delicious sauce. The fries are also very good and the spices that are sprinkled on to them make them even better. If you like fries, you'll love nando's fries. However before you go to nando's, make sure that you like spicy food, because that's what makes it so great ! When I order my meal, I usually go for hot in the peri-peri scale. The 'hot' option is spicy enough to for you to feel the heat but yet preserve the tasty. The extra hot is just too spicy and even a spice lover like me won't like it as much. It gets to the point where it's just too hot and ruins the taste somewhat. If you are a moderate spice lover, well, i recommend medium for you. You can still go if you can't stand spicy food and get the 'lemon and herb' option.  I found the service to be average. Nothing special about that...  The only downside to Nando's is that it is a little overpriced. If you want a good meal, you will probably end up using about $20 or more. But trust me, the price is worth it once in a while. Although the franchise is not as prominent in Canada as in other countries like the U.A.E, I would definitely recommend trying it out.
I think this restaurant may be part of the same chain as the one in the UK.  this place has awesome chicken.   give the hot sauce a try but beware, it continues to burn!

I was familiar with Nando's as a very popular fast-food joint (that seeks to operate like a restaurant) in Malaysia and Dubai. I find that in in Calgary their menu is limited and they don't have a wide variety of sauces.   The last time I went to Nando's I noticed most of the old seats were ripped or had huge holes in them... Also it was quite noisy, I could hear kids crying both to my left and right! Then I noticed dust in the air (which made my friend go aachooo!) and when I saw staff sweeping the floor I had to cover my drink with a napkin and was glad our food hadn't arrived yet!   The portions are smaller but the quality of food is good...  I tried their rice once and it was undercooked, I never risked it again. You can't go wrong with the peri fries and the staff have not disappointed so far!
Not at the same level as the Nando's restaurant sin the UK. The portions are smaller the menu selection has less variety. overpriced for what you get. the flavor of the food is good.

Best chicken place in Toronto for sure! The restaurant has a very warm and cozy atmosphere and is a perfect place for a first date!  The table service is very minimum. You order at the cash with your table number and someone will bring your food to your table. While you wait, you will have to grab your own cutlery and sauces. Their grilled chicken is absolutely amazing! Juicy and tender! (Even the chicken breast) The rice is well seasoned and cooked. I would personally advise not ordering the mashed potatoes as they have a tangy sour taste to them.  Overall the food and service was exceptional and the restaurant is definitely in my top 2 best chicken places in Toronto =)

I have been a Nando's customer at Richmond-hill location  and other locations around Ontario and the world for more than 5 years. We received a terrible service today from a server wearing a red shirt at the cash register. From the moment we walked in and started placing our order, she badvibed us and illustrated a very negative attitude and rudeness towards us. They also ran out of plastic cutlery and I was told that our server would be bringing them to our table. Unfortunately the same lady at the cash brought us our food and failed to bring us cutlery. When I asked for it, she rudely told us "to get it yourself" I understand that she might have had a difficult day but she shouldn't have put it on us! She also didn't properly apologize for her terrible behavior.  I probably won't go back:(

We waited an hour for our food, the free wifi wasn't working, they ran out of the desserts I wanted, and the fro-yo machine was busted for a bit. All of that being said, I still officially love this place. I've been to Nando's in Vancouver, but never to one out east. It's also been a few years since I've had Nando's chicken in general. First off, it's gorgeous inside. I've been waiting for this location to open for months now. For the longest time all I saw was construction equipment and loose wires inside whenever I walked by. Walking was like WOW. Secondly, this is already a really popular spot. It was packed inside and the line up almost went out the door for ordering. Luckily dining in wasn't full, so I got a table with my friends right away.  When we went up to order we were told that it would be an hour wait for our food. If this were any other establishment I would've been pissed, but I've been craving Nando's for a while. Sadly the free wifi wasn't working, which isn't really a big deal since not all restaurants have it anyway. It just would've made the wait time go by much faster is all. Food: awesome, juicy chicken. Just the way I remember it. Decent sized portions for a great price. They also added new items to the menu since I've been, including desserts. I was upset that they ran out of both cheesecake and chocolate cake (my 2 faves), but I tried the carrot cake and it was fantastic. I don't normally like carrot cake, but this one wasn't too sweet. It might be one of the best carrot cakes I've ever had. Lastly, they have bottomless pop and juice. There's a machine with a touch screen that allows you to choose from over 100 drinks. It's just a $2.49 flat rate and you can have as much as you want. Same goes with the fro-yo machine. $3.99 flat rate and take as much as you want.

I have always loved Nando's. But I am very disappointed from last nights experience at this location. I ordered a quarter chicken meal (leg and thigh), spicy level hot, a little before 10 pm. The chicken was not flavourful at all. In fact, the meat was hard and somewhat chewy!! It tasted like fake chicken. And the potato wedges also did not have enough peri peri flavouring as it usually does. I think I was served old chicken and wedges! This location is open till 11pm and I don't understand why I'm getting old food at 10pm.  I'm extremely disappointed and may not return to this location for takeout.

chicken was juicy and the flavour on the exterior of the chicken was quite good. I ordered 2 large sides to share amongst 2 people in total. we got the potato wedges and a house salad. the salad contained a variety of spring mix, romaine, cucumbers and baby tomatoes. the quality of the salad was fresh and crisp. the array of sauces to use on our chicken, salad, etc was excellent, as there were a variety, ranging from mild, to extra hot.  potato wedges were delicious. overall a great lunch, and you get a great portion for the price!

Good food, but you just don't feel like you're getting value.  $11 bucks for a grilled half-chicken and a side?  I'd rather spend 8 bucks for the half, and leave the side as an option. That being said, their sauce is awesome.

The positives;  Chicken was tasty,  Restaurant is nice  The negatives;  Half of the staff act like they have been sentenced to community service in nandos! One or two really enthusiastic people around but most of them seemed fed up being there. Pretty sure the girl at the cash was trying to impale her pen in the touch screen every time she prodded it   Portions are tiny! Unless you are a small young rabbit avoid the regular size Caesar salad. My gf ordered this & I'm not lying when I say you'd probably get more salad on a Big Mac!!  My fries were cold. I brought then up to the desk & they replaced them with marginally warmer ones at which point I just ate them.   All in all I probably wont go back but I must admit the chicken was good albeit a smallish portion.

Long time did I not have such juicy chicken when not at home.  This Portuguese chicken is good with the peri-peri hot sauce but I can only take mild and it's still good.  The price is a bit expensive.  You basically order your dishes and find a table to sit down.  The dishes will be served to you by the waitress.  The staff is polite.  The cole slaw is creamy and is good.  We also buy a Portuguese custard tart.  The custard texture is good except the crust is not crispy anymore.  I tried the same tart in Macau (previously governed by Portugal) that is so much better.
Looks great, but doesn't match the expectation in the food. This is a place for families or rowdy groups, not for a significant get together.

The chicken was good.  I found the garlic peri peri sauce hotter than the hot sauce.  Decent sized portion of potato wedges which looked disproportionate to the garlic mashed.  Both were satisfactory.  Didn't think a full plate would be enough for 3 big eaters but the huge plate of potato wedges filled us up.  Was disappointed with the garlic bread more like garlic hamburger bun.  I thought it was pricey in comparison for the amount of chicken.  The dining room is way too packed.  Aisle ways are too narrow and so are the booths.  Place is noisy with all the hard surfaces.  The food was decent but I wouldn't go back just for the uncomfortableness of the seating.

Nando's is always a great choice for a delicious meal! My first experience(s) were when I was living in the UK and since this location has opened I've come on a somewhat regular basis. We often opt-in to their share platters that include chicken, a side or two and Portuguese buns and/or garlic bread. We never leave feeling unfulfilled and often have leftovers for lunch the next day.

Not nearly as good as the one at Eglington. Here they seem to be more about the decor than the food. The decor being somewhat of a confused fusion between different cultures. The first time I went here the waitress brought the wrong order, oh and brought the wrong order for my girlfriend as well. The second time I visited this place I had the chicken peri peri burger or some variation of that. It was interesting as I got to learn what a rock in a bun tastes like. It seemed like the chicken in that bun was the most abused and battered chicken that ever lived. Travel the distance and go to the one at eglington, they too are slow and careless but their chicken is good.

My mother and I decided to stop and Try out Nandos this evening and we got seated and before my Mom or me had a chance to order we started coughing because of the extreme amount of smoke that was in the building by the time we went to order the smoke was overwhelming and we had to walk out my Mom is still coughing we are now taking her to the hospital. I don't recommend anyone go to this place. I'm for sure going to report this to the authorities.

This is more or less a self served restaurant.  You order at the cashier and you get your own drinks at this Coke machine which offers like hundreds of choices.  The chicken was really nice and tender, I had it with the medium hot sauce and it was perfect.  You get a choice of sides and I got the spiced rice, very good as well. The reason it gets the 4 star and not 5 is because I found that the dark meat is a little too tender and not as lean as I would like.  I prefer the dark meat at places like Swiss Chalet.  This is a great place for lunch.

I got attract but the decoration and tried this franchise for the first time.  The decor is colorful and cozy but the foods is just ok. I ordered 1/4  chicken breast with fries.  The chicken was juicy and delicious.  My meal cost me around 18$.  It is pricy for a piece of chicken and fries.

Spacious place with nice decor. That's all I can say positive.   Very disappointed with the food. A grilled chicken from Sobeys  tastes better than this place's specialty.   Coleslaw didn't taste any better either.    Perrier was good ;).   I wouldn't recommend this place to my friends. In fact I am still upset with my friend who brought me there.

I would not recommend this place to anyone. I purchased a Groupon voucher months ago and was not able to use it here. The cashier had no idea about it so the manager was consulted, the manager refused to accept it. Consulted with Groupon who advise the voucher was issues by head office so it is acceptable at all locations. Sounds to me the manager was being a douche.   Food here is mediocre, I've had better tasting chicken at their Woodbridge and Richmond Hill locations.

I like the food on this place. Decent price yet they have a very unusual service. Quite frankly, felt entirely like a fast food chain every thing is self serve.  Once they hand you your food over,  you pretty much have to take care of your self.    The food is nothing special. Their sauce makes a difference and they have lots of variety. Well not that much but you can pick which sauce you want and have as much as you want.   After all that; once you're done, you have the option to leave things and they'll clean it up for you but if you have left overs and wanted to take it home, you can pack it up yourself.   I love chicken but way to ruin a great meal because you don't have the service you're looking for at a restaurant. Also, you have to pay your TIP up front when you order at the counter instead of the usual waiters taking your orders.   I think the customers here deserve the TIPs for serving themselves.
Pleasant staff. Great vegan options, staff was super helpful/accompdatibEverything was very tasty. Quick service. Clean space. I'll be going back.

My friend and I went here after watching a basketball game. Since we didn't pay for overpriced arena food, we were starving. There wasn't many people when we entered, yet it took 5 minutes just to take our order. We just awkwardly hovered over the front desk waiting to order. When we got our food, I was starving so unfortunately I wasn't looking too closely at what I was eating. The chicken was undercooked and caused me to experience significant stomach indigestion (I am writing this in pain). Not coming back, didn't know there was such a thing as medium rare chicken.

I have to say, for a professional establishment, the staff and service is sub par. Either they're poorly understaffed and too many duties on everyone's plate OR the staff isn't properly trained. I'm stuck using this place when I crave Nandos Bc it's the closest - but I have yet to encounter an establishment with such poor etiquette. I've been randomly hung up on, they get rude, or just plain don't provide satisfactory service.   I can't believe they screwed up an order and told me one thing on the phone and another to my husband in person. They made him pay extra, when they were really supposed to refund money. I'm not going to go all the way back over 5 bucks, but i will take the time to write a review.   This location and it's management needs to really get it together and give people consistent service. Even the food quality is hit and miss. Sometimes the rice is so dry, other times it's great. Today my chicken was cooked just right and juicy, but our fries were over salted and ridiculously soggy. I also don't know what type of garlic sauce they're using for their bread but it tastes more metallic than anything else.  Sigh. Place needs a service overhaul BADLY

As a virgin to the ever popular nando's chicken in my area, I was excited to try out the flavours of portegul. Now I will say, the flavour of the sauces themselves packed a little punch, but that's about where it stops. I ordered the quarter chicken, breast and wing..... Which they didn't have...... At lunch. They do know people come in for lunch right??? 10 mins later, I watch the patron beside me get a breast! Ugh. I had the salad and peri peri veggies. The veggies were good. The weird dressing... Not so much.  To sim this up, way over prices for substandard food. The leg way scrawny, good was a poor temperature. Keep on going IMO.

I have been a customer at a variety of different Nandos restaurants now for the past ten years across Toronto, Richmond Hill and Mississauga. So I was obviously excited to learn that there would now be an option in the city. I was totally disappointed last night when I finally had a chance to visit. We always order the full pack which comprises of a whole chicken, two large sides and a order of garlic bread. For the two of us this is just enough to fill us for dinner and have a lot left over. (We rather have more food than still be hungry after dinner). The food took very long to arrive at our table. The kitchen staff was so disorganized that they had to come to our table and ask me what I ordered because they misplaced their copy receipt.    When the food finally arrived, I immediately had to ask a couple questions as the food quantity was totally different from what I was used to. Firstly the large rice came in a very small bowel which could not have been holding more than to tablespoons of rice, the chicken which was supposed to be a whole chicken cut in eight pieces look like it was four regular sized pieces of chicken( two legs, a breast and a thigh) and four mini pieces of chicken (I'm talking like bite size - as if they took two pieces of chicken and cut it into four) I could not believe what they were serving us in comparison to what we normally get at the other locations.( We visit Nandos once a month) The location on Laird has never done this to us. Lastly but certainly not least the salad came to our table (LAST) ok so at every other normal location you can get the Mediterranean salad as a side - not at this location!! You can only get the Csar salad or a house salad, I chose the house salad. When they finally realized that they had forgotten our salad, it arrived at or table. The greens were all wilted and old. The salad was made of stale ingredients, I could not believe they would serve customers this quality of food. Needless to say this was a very very bad Nandos experience that will not be taking place again. I would rather wait and go to a different location. Never again.

Nando's grill was such a neat experience and the food was tasty. I had a veggie burger it was smothered in the house made spicy sauce, wasn't really my cup of tea but the chicken was wonderful, or so I was told as I am a vegetarian :)

I'd heard of Nandos and I've always wanted to try Peri-Peri chicken. We were sat down at our table and given menus then had to go back to the front to order which is awkward. I noticed the plate sizes of a few ppl sitting around us so I ordered the 2 piece thigh and drumstick so I could give my brother the extra drumstick. Water cost $2 and I was given a cup which at first puzzled me lol after ordering you go pick up your cutlery and bottled sauces. For the $2 water you can pick up a corked bottled water which was nice. Wait time for the food was average to most restaurants and when it arrived it looked good. The 2 sides I ordered were corn on the cob which was grilled yet the butter had a hard time melting on it and the garlic mashed potatoes which were incredible but not plentiful. The hot Peri sauce made my mouth tingle for awhile lol. All in all the only problem I had with Nandos were the portion sizes. If i hadn't ordered that extra piece of chicken I'm sure I would have been hungry a couple hours later. If you want bang for your buck you're better off going to Cristy's chicken a few blocks down.

I decided to give this place another shot after my previous mediocre experience. 8 hours after my meal, I began experiencing symptoms of food poisoning, and now they won't let up. I know this caused it because this is the only change I made to my diet within the last few days. I cannot even remember the last time I threw up, but after eating this I managed to do so (around 8 times). I'm going to miss an important party tomorrow, and I have Nandos to thank for it. Will never eat here again.

This chain was recommended to me as the go to for chicken. The chicken was amazing! We got the breast and wing combo and it was so juicy and flavorful. We tried the lemon and herb and the medium spice. Definitely take advantage of their flavor sauces as well if you want a little extra kick. And the garlic bread was really good too. Disappointed with the spiced rice, looked and tasted like it had been out for a while but the cashier was willing to switch it out for another side so we got a corn on the cob. Slightly grilled and it was decent. All in all the flame grilled chicken is the real story here and I would definitely come back again. If you're from the states as we are the comparable would be el pollo loco but this has it beat for me!

Great place to get a quick fix if you're feeling a bit homesick! The only differences are that the extra hot isn't really quite "extra hot" compared to South Africa; and the slight menu variation. I really hope they bring the chicken breast and hot pots here one day.
Great place!  Huge portions and the service was spectacular
The whole wheat chicken wrap that I got was very good. Spicy but not as spicy as I would have liked. Great price point.
This was probably my 50th half chicken meal at the nandos location. Quality food, beautiful decor, and very friendly staff. The key to the success of this location is consistency.

Food is great  but my only concern is how the sauce bottles seems unsanitary. Anybody can grab the bottle of sauce to their table. Touch it with their greasy hands( maybe some cough and saliva  flying while the bottle is on the customer's table) and staff will just return it back without sanitizing the bottle for the next customer...

Top quality Portuguese churrasco style Chicken joint. Atmosphere is nice, think log cabin meets European homestead. Busy during lunches, you're greeted at the door, and seated; then you have to wait in line and order your food (as opposed to having a waitress take your order).  You also have to get your own napkins and cutlery, there's plenty bottles of 'peri peri' sauce to bring back to your table.  Mild, hot, super hot whatever your tolerance is there's a sauce for you. Get the chicken, it's good. Marinated and grilled properly melts off the bone and is very flavourful.  Regardless whether it's in a wrap, sandwich, or on a plate -  its tender and delicious!

My mouth is watering as I write this review. I love the chicken ceaser wrap and their peri peri fries.  I love the peanuts mmmmm I love basically everything.  They only thing I'm not a fan of is waiting in line to put in your order. It's like half take out and half dine in. Maybe they are trying to save money on staff? They may as well have a self serve counter to put in your own order lol but the food is great so I won't complain.
Chicken is soooo good, i can eat a whole chicken by myself.   super healthy and great food. make sure you try the chicken liver.
Halal, colorful, amazing grilled chicken. Freshly cooked, with alot of varieties of side order. You gotta try it!!
Very bad for take out this location. Terribly understaffed. Food is ready but sits there forever because the same people are on triple duty. I'll never come again during dinner hour.

Nando's has been a favourite of my husbands and I since its the one among the non-Indian food that has a nice kick too it. And it really does have a kick to it... lol.  The Nando's at Bay St. has a really warm atmosphere and the service is really good. I ordered some wings with a side of spiced rice and my husband had the chicken skewers with potato wedges. This was our first time ordering the skewers and I told my H that he should ask about the quantity and sure enough he didn't and sure enough it was not much (I've put up pics). Its really just two skewers and not enough meat! My husband ended up eating half my wings and side and another dinner after... I think that gives you an idea about the quantity.   Apart from that minor glitch... the food as always was amazing and we as usual bought a bottle of Nando's sauce (my fav is Lemon and Herb!).   So if you are craving chicken in some spicy sauce definitely give Nando's a try. I'm not really a fan of chain restaurants but Nando's is an exception. :)

I had very high expectations, I was somewhat disappointed. I was expecting a nice juicy tasting chicken with seasoning... And the chicken was so plain, I couldn't finish it. Peri peri fries were okay, fries should be crispy not soft. And the mashed potato was good. It was a one time place, I tried it, now I don't think I'll go back.

The chicken at Nandos is tender and juicy.  I have tried it quite a few times & it has been very consistent.  If you don't like spicy food stick with one of the milder options.  You can always add the spicy garlic sauce on the table to it but it's hard to make it less spicy.  :)  The fries are always fresh & tasty.  I like their peri peri dip (kind of like a mayo with some spices mixed in) for the fries but it's a tiny cup which they charge aroud a $1 for so I'm not sure it's worth it.

I was pretty psyched about the first Nando's in downtown Toronto. I used to love this place as a late night fast food option during the years I lived in Nairobi, Kenya. It was cheap, open and pretty decent for post-bar food.  Not so fast. This place is trying to be more of a sit-down restaurant with table service. It's not really quite there, however. When I arrived (party of one) I was told to pick up a menu and order from the till, which is pretty awkward. My waiter wouldn't seat me, but kind of rudely gestured to a table across the room.  I ordered my meal with some suggestions from the friendly girl at the till. 1/4 chicken (leg & thigh) plus 2 sides (peri-peri fries & casa salad) and a soft drink. The total came to something over $16 + tip. So yeah, we're already way out of the league of most fast-food places.  Having paid, I trudged over and picked up some hot sauce and napkins from a huge shelf at the back. My food arrived pretty quickly, but I realized I would need to go back to the shelf for cutlery. Another trip was required when I realized the "casa salad" was undressed. What a pain.   The chicken leg was good, but small. The fries were limp and lukewarm. They seem to have run out of fries too, as a few small wedges were thrown in to fill it out. The salad, in addition to being undressed was as basic as salads come. It was served in a tiny bowl, which meant it was impossible to dress properly, or eat without dropping cucumbers or lettuce leaves.   The waiter popped by once for a cursory "how's everything" to which I lied, "fine."  Overall this place is a kind of ethnic-theme-park-pseudo-fast-food restaurant with half-decent chicken at inflated prices. I won't be back anytime soon. Shame. They should have stuck with the fast-food philosophy instead of this half-way bucket of mediocre.

I've been to this Nando's location plenty of times and service fluctuates a lot, so does the food quality.   It is pricey for what you get and I usually get the chicken breast/wing combo with one side. Sometimes, if I feel like it, I'll get the chicken livers (just the app).. it's seriously so good. Get the garlic "heat" and it's great. The food is good.   I've only had one bad incident where I ordered my usual 1/4 chicken breast/wing combo and everyone at my table was served while I was waiting for my plate. After 5 minutes, I went up and asked and they said "oh, we missed your order, we'll make it right away". So I waited, very hungry at this point. My friends didn't want to start without me. When I finally got my plate, I hungrily ate everything quickly. Then I noticed they gave me 1/4 chicken (leg and thigh combo). By that time, I had already all everything so I couldn't argue. I went up and told them they delayed my order and messed it up. They didn't even apologize!   Anyway, I would suggest going to Churasso Villa just a couple blocks away! I heard it's really good. Next time, I guess.  P.S. You pay first and have to include the tip beforehand.. so the process is a bit backwards.

I can sum up this place with one word : Interesting. And because of this I'd say it's A-OK. It's hard for me to rate Nandos as this is the only place I know of to get peri-peri chicken. Definitely the draw of this place is the different types of chillies/sauces you get to try with the chicken each having a very distinctive and interesting flavor. Drawbacks are that the serving isn't particularly large so I never get full afterwards and the chicken does tend to be on the dry side from time to time.

For a chain restaurant, this place has fantastic decor.  It is very open concept and sort of puts you in a different place besides Canada.  Their chicken is well prepared as it is their specialty. I prefer this over Swiss Chalet any day. Their peri peri sauce is literally the bomb.  It is slightly overpriced, but I would still return.

Best ever! Nothing bad to say about this place. Excellent customer service. Food is a lot better than their other sister Nandos locations and best of all, the chicken is well done without having to ask over and over again. Their fries portions are great too. Definitely pays homage to their franchise back in Zambia. Well done!

Why does Nando's rock? For one, the crispy, juicy deliciousness of the chicken. But more importantly, the sauce. I have thought about drinking it. You can buy it at some grocery stores and once I bought the entire stock (9 bottles) because it was on sale. It's that good. Even though the chicken is pre-sauced, you'll probably end up pouring tons on during the meal. Addictive stuff with a citrus flavor and a nice heat that isn't too overwhelming even at the extra hot.  Here's how it works: Pick out which kinds of chicken you want (half/full chicken, wings, or skewers in any combination) the spiciness level of the chicken from mild to extra hot (you can do half and half on any order) and your sides. Then you get a number and sit down and they'll bring your food to you.  If you like spicy, flavorful chicken, this is as good as it gets. By the way, the reviews below about the veggie options totally miss the mark. The name of the place is Nando's Flame Grilled CHICKEN. I can appreciate not eating meat, but don't judge a place for options it only provides as a last resort for those who would otherwise not be able to eat anything while their meat eating friends are dining. The price is right and you get pretty decent portions. For 27 bucks we got enough food for two men and one woman.
I am a chicken person and i must say the chicken is well cooked.the spices are balance.my personal favourite is the herb and lime chicken with spicy rice.my kids love it too!

The chicken you get is a very small amount for what you pay for it. The fries were good but the glasses they give out for the pop are very small, even though refills are free. Service was friendly and on time. I give this place 2 stars. Would've given it 3 but they're very overpriced for the amount of food you get.

3 stars just for the consistency of the chicken & the peri-peri sauces. Other than that, this branch sucks for big groups. Details regarding this are on the tip I posted.   I don't expect this review to be recommended,  but in any case I only recommend going to this particular branch if & only if: - you have a lot of time - you're in a good mood - don't require ketchup because it gets hard to locate this condiment if you asked any of the staff - you're in a group of no more than two - you eat during off-peak hours

Great food, great price. Really reasonably priced food. Even though the portions were not the largest, it was still filling. It was my first time there and I got a chicken pita which was really good, with their peri peri fries, and it was about $10.  The bathroom was very clean, and had a separate sink for the stall which was a really great small thing that I appreciated. I would definitely recommend this place.

My first time at a Nandos. It was OK but not spectacular. I expected more flavour and crispy skin from the chicken. I chose the spiciest sauce and it was milder than Tabasco and a bit too sweet- I prefer a Southern US or Mexican hot sauce. Pretty good value for money, but the ambiance is somewhere between a restaurant and a food court.

Hands down, the best flame grilled chicken!  I'm not too crazy about the sides, but the chicken liver is definitely worth ordering.  The restaurant itself is very busy and small- I would recommend taking your food home or even buying their sauce and marinating your own chicken!

I am very sad to give Nando's only two stars, but this is my second visit to this location and no impressed.  I have enjoyed the companies product for a long time and used to go to the (now closed) Bathurst and Eglinton location and then the Richmond Hill store.  I ordered the half chicken and my friend the quarter white, both with wedges and slaw.  We also order a hummus appetizer.   After waiting and waiting my friend went up to check on the hummus and was told they would check.  Wait wait wait and finally it arrives along with mains. When question are told "Well I didn't want your chicken to get cold".  Ooooook right sure what does one want with an appetizer that comes with the meal? But no let me take that off your bill.  Then when done the manager or owner comes by and asks how it was and explain to him this. He says let me talk to the kitchen, never hear from him again.  No one offered to remove the item or even say they were sorry.  As a side note when one orders a half chicken it should come as a half a chicken and not two pieces that were never from the same chicken.  Also chicken portions here are getting smaller and boarder on Cornish hen size.  Although I like Nando's in general do not know if I will return to this location.

My first experience with Nando's Chicken happened to be while I was dating a guy on the West Coast. I should have known he wasn't the brightest crayon in the box when his idea of a good time was taking his vegetarian girlfriend to a chicken joint.   Lucky for me, Nando's chicken doesn't serve chicken alone. Unlike Mr. boyfriend, they keep vegetarians' needs in mind. For those of us who don't eat bird, they serve wraps, veggie burgers, salads, fries, rice, baked potatoes and dessert.   The food was decent, as was the pricing.   I recently took a trip down memory lane by visiting the location here in Calgary, and I was happy to see that my experience here parallelled my experience in BC.   The service is fast, the food is decent, and the atmosphere is welcoming.

This place is amazing!   But Lets get the negative out of the way right from the get go because there is only one - price to portion ratio. Yes the chickens are a little anorexic given what you pay BUT - they tastez so guuuddd. KFC can be "finger licking" good all they want, Nandos is "Hand licking, down my forearm, maybe even lick my elbow if some sauce ends up there - GOOD."  I have one long time friend that I do not get to hang out with as much as I would like to, BUT we always make an effort to visit Nandos together 2-3 times a year. Unbeknownst to him I refuse to go there without out him - its kinda our thing.   Each time we go we always order the same meal: The Four Pack ($32) and 4 Heineken. The Four pack comes with a whole flame-grilled chicken, your choice of 2 large sidelines, and 3 Portuguese buns or garlic bread. For the sidelines we always get their Caesar salad and the Peri Peri fries - which are tossed in a dry Peri peri salt and are AMAZEBALLS!   As for the Peri Peri marinade at Nandos you can order any of their items in either Garlic, Medium, Hot or Extra Hot or EXTRA EXTRA Hot. My friend and I always stupidly think we are bigger than the hot sauce and go XX Hot - silly boys. Midway through we are gasping, the tears streaming down our faces are a mix of pain and joy and we have completed all 4 of our beers.   Usually around this time we are usually reaching for the bottles of peri peri garlic sauce on our table and our fries to try and calm our burning tongues  - thank goodness for the garlic bread (always comes in handy).   There has seldom been a time when I have gone to Nandos where I have not left there, satisfied, full, happy and mouth still burning. I look forward to seeing my friend next because I know exactly where we will be going for dinner that night :)

Amazing flavor.. what can I say I love chicken. The Piri Piri fries is a must have. I got half a chicken - Extra hot.  It was delivered on time and I had a blast.  I did have some ambivalence when I was ordering as there are so  much good thins on the menu.. I was thinking of devouring a full chicken.. that in itself would be a feature presentation and a thing to watch ;).. I am glad I got the half chicken it was perfect I hope they open another location in the SW. I live in the SW and drove all the way to the NE for Nando's.. but it was so worth it.  The day I went, they played some salsa music, which was amazing.. I love the ambiance, my personal trainer is so mad at me now.. as I indulge in Nando's flame grilled chicken,, I hope she does not read this review ;)

Let's just say Nando's chicken taste better than Swiss Chalet chicken. I came here for dinner on a weekend and it was packed. It looks like a sit down restaurant with waiter service but it is not. The hostess will sit you down and give you the menus but you have to go up to the counter to order the food and pay. They give you a glass of water so you can take it back to your table. Also, cutlery, napkins, sauce and drinks are all self-serve.  The food came in a timely manner has my party got the variety chicken assortment where it came with 2 chicken skewers, 5 wings and  1/2 chicken. Overall, the chicken had a lot of grill flavour even though we got it plain. The chicken skewers were definitely the driest out of the bunch and sauce was a necessity to eat it. The wings were great as I would give them 5 stars. Taste hot and came straight out from the grill. The  1/2 chicken was also decent. It was moist and not too dry. The skin was good as well.  For the sides, we got the Caesar salad and mashed potatoes. These were so-so. Variety said it could serve 2-3 people but I guess for 2 hungry people it was not enough. So we ordered a large Caesar, Portuguese custard tart and corn. The Caesar salad dressing was not too sour so it was good. If the Portuguese custard tart were warmer, it would be great. Corn was so-so as well.  Overall, the chicken is the outstanding part of the meal as the sides are average.

My first negative review.  The chicken is the best, and the corn was good, however I suggest take out for this place. The place was dirty. There were 5-6 tables with dishes stacked. Floor and washrooms a mess.  A few of the staff just did not care and were not talking to each other nicely. The guy in charge of our table was eating his cake and milk instead of Serving our food. On a Saturday night they were running out of chicken!  Coleslaw did not taste, and even their famous fries seemed hard and reheated.

The chicken is alright, but not outstanding. Everything about this place is kinda forgettable. I mean, it's just nando's, only come here if it's convenient and you're craving chicken. The "hot" sauce is not even remotely hot, and the other sauces were alright. The value is not that great either. We got the family deal that comes with corn and bread, but in retrospect we could have gotten more food for the same money from the dim sum and chicken section at t&t in the same plaza. Nando's = meh.

I love Nando's chicken as much as I love Swiss chalet.  The decor at this Nando is very nice and inviting. This place itself isn't that big and can fill up quickly during the weekends.     I got the half chicken with 2 sidelines (spiced rice and fries).  The chicken here is always cooked to perfection and isn't dry at all.  The spice on the chicken is amazing as well as the sauce. They have a wide variety of sauce for your liken from spicy to non-spicy ones.  I am sure you will be able to find one you like.  Pricing is reasonable for what you are getting and will fill you up for sure.  Rating:  Service: 3/5 Food Quality: 3/5 Comfort 3/5 Decor  4/5 Value: 4/5 Parking: 4/5

I totally dis-agree w/ some people w/ a poor review. Been going here ever since and the service and food is perfect compared in Nandos downtown. Here in Eglington location they serve the best tender-juicy grilled chicken ever! Service crew give you a warm welcome smile and they are really good on what they do. More importantly is the food- the food here is grilled and serve fresh and hot. Keep the good vibe Nandos Eglington.

The set-up for Nando's is like a fast food restaurant: pay up front then take a seat. Grab your own utensils and drink. Actually they seat you first then you go order, but I prefer if this was reversed.   This location has very nice decor and a great ambiance. Gets very busy during dinnertime.   Service was slow. You can see they have many orders (dine-in and take-out) to fulfill. I had the dark meat quarter chicken with 2 sides: peri peri fries and peri-peri vegetables for $12.85. The chicken was lemon and herb, which was tasty. Not a huge portion but succulent. The fries were nicely seasoned but disappointingly not super crispy. I ordered the peri-peri vegetables to up my veggie intake and I really should not have. It was mostly peppers and I was excited seeing all the minced garlic, but the sauce really threw me off. It added a sour taste to everything.   My previous times here, the chicken has been consistent and tasty, so you can count on it tasting good. Service and sides are questionable.
Nandos is nandos. Like the food is what you expect from any other nandos but what is special about this location is the decor. Never have I been to a nandos that looked as nice as this one.

I always get my favourite thing on the menu here. The peri peri chicken sandwich and the potato wedges (my friend gets the mashed potatoes so we get the best of both). The service was BAD though, so slow and it took so long just to refill our waters. Other locations are better than this.

I came very excited to try Nando's for the first time because I wanted to try something new but left very disappointed. The chicken was nothing special and the vegetables in the side salad I ordered were all wilted and disgusting. I asked to change it to rice and even the rice was all hard and tasted as if it was a  couple of weeks old. The prices here are very unreasonable and this was probably one of my worse eating out experiences. I definitely will not be coming back here again.

I've been here 3 times now and each time I leave feeling dissatisfied. The chicken portions are small.  The sides are decent, like the fries. Their sides are nothing to write home about. They make a good sangria. The chicken I always get tends to be on the drier side.  Their sauces are what stands out at this place.  Other than that I'd rather cook my own chicken than pay the price at Nandos. I hope my friends don't drag me here again haha.

Nando's is an Afro-Portuguese restaurant specializing in various dishes mostly grill chicken oriented. The chicken and rice dishes are characterized by lemon, spices and Peri-Peri. Peri-Peri is African Birdseye Chili and has a sweet distinctive flavour, definitely goes hand in hand w/ lemon and garlic.  Overall I feel the food is overpriced for what you get. I do enjoy some meals at Nando's, yet some meals remain under par. At times the chicken is way overcooked, rendering thee meat dry and burnt. Other times the chicken is cooked well, but there's barely any meat on the bone, especially with their wings. The portions and quality of food is inconsistent, questionable for the price you pay.   I do really enjoy the Peri-Peri seasoned chips (fries), they are always a staple for me if I eat chez Nando's. Other sides include spiced rice, baked potatoes, coleslaw and corn. Whenever ordering my meal I always use a fair amount of Nando's house sauces such as the hot Peri-Peri and Garlic sauce.  I couldn't see myself going out of my way to eat at Nando's, but it is a decent restaurant with good service. A big plus for them is they have a well crafted and interactive website.
