It provides you with a solid history of the franchise, as well as recipes to their dishes! I find that to be so rare these days. If you're interested in hitting this joint ;) find a place near you.   http://www.nandoscanada.com/sections.html#Our%20Restaurants

PERI PERI!!!!!!!  Nando's is great healthy chicken. The service is good, the food is better and their sauces are just unreal! Anytime you are around Yonge and Rutherford (16th ave) and have 30 mins you can spare or need to waste, check out Nando's! As a bonus, if you eat your chicken really fast and still need to waste more time, there is mini golf and laser tag in the plaza ! YAY!!!!!

I had heard only good things about this chain from a friend who just luvs this place. She goes on and on about how great their piri piri sauces are and even stocks up on them at home :) Since we were a larger group we called in and tried to make a reservation but nope they only take those for groups of 15 people +. Ah well since my hosts live nearby we decided to just venture out here. The place is quite big and there is a steady flow of customers to keep them busy.  We ordered two family combos a couple of skewers and for moi and an another adventurous eater we ordered the chicken livers as well. The ordering part is kind of painful IMO even though I was with a person who is well versed with their menu.  Never mind we waited for our food patiently. The first two combos arrived fast but we were told the buns would have to wait till later, not a good sign if they are out of fresh bread. Then we were told the chicken livers would take longer as well, understandable as I am guessing its not their hot seller (being not for the faint of heart I suppose :)  I tried the medium spiced level as there were some children in our group that couldn't handle hot food. Even for a medium the chicken is spiced well. Nice, juicy finish for the dark meat. White meat was not as moist but still better than your supermarket chicken by a long mile. The really hot sauce packed a wallop as well. Sides were mundane IMO. Even after 20 min had elapsed there was no sign of the chicken hearts or the dinner rolls. We were told we had a to wait a bit longer hmm not good as it was bordering on unacceptable. Finally the chicken livers arrived but still no sign of the dinner rolls. We had ordered the livers hot spice level. They don't pull any punches here and it tasted good. I will try again for sure. The skewers were popular as well.  Some of the kids wanted dessert and sure enough the froyo machine was broken. We decided to subs for a Portuguese tart but still a no go as there was a wait on them. Finally the kids settled on ice cream. They brought us an extra serving but the ridiculous wait had spoiled it for me. Ice cream was decent Then we got the dinner rolls after all the food had finished!  The service needs an overhaul here as there were far too many mistakes in the order. The did make up for after asking for it several times but it has brought this place down a notch in my book. 3.5 Stars for food half star deducted for the multiple order mix ups.
I don't see how chicken can get any better than this. The Nando's sauces are to die for. A little pricey perhaps, but worth every penny.

I first heard about Nando's from my friend Jennifer, she got a tip from a taxi driver for great chicken. The lesson learned here, Uber drivers likely have better recommendations. If you're looking for that true Portuguese taste with all that super Churrasco flavor then pass this place by, you won't find it here. I find it interesting how many say the service here is good when their is hardly any service provided at all. Nando's feels more like a self serve cafeteria than a restaurant. You seat yourself, they bring you a menu and tell you the rules, yes, rules. 1).  go to the cash to order and pay for your food in advance.  So you get up from your table and go to order your food and pay before you eat.  2). you are told not to forget your table number. 3).  The cashier reminds you to pick up your silverware and napkins before you sit down. 4). They bring you your food which in my case was cold (if you like cold fries you are in luck). 5). You have to get back up from your meal and seat to get any condiments,  and don't forget any as you will have to get up again. 6).  No one checks in on you to see if everything is ok or offers to bring you more water. 7). After your meal you leave and no one notices you going or thanks you for your patronage. This service is not too different from a McDonalds.  The food itself is on pare with Swiss Chalet and the acoustics suck. My opinion this place has nothing going for it and I won't be back. WARNING DON'T ORDER THE GREEN PEAS!

Best Nandos location!!! Ambiance is great. Very festive and cultural. Other locations are quite small but this one is massive. Can accompany large parties easily. Food is amazing as always. Different concept with drinks-it has that new "choose your own" drink vending machine which is unlimited refills. You have to grab your own cutlery and peri peri sauce bottles. But it gives you a chance to walk around and explore the place!

First time trying Nandos, my friend mentioned he saw different menu items compared to the one he goes to in DC. The chicken was tasty and I liked that the sauces were available so that you could try difference ones or add more. Tried the new crusted wings, they were delicious! The only thing was that it was more pricey than what I expected for the serving portions. My chicken sandwich had a sad ratio of bread to chicken.

I came to Nando's yesterday with a few friends for lunch. It was my first time and immediately upon walking in I was very impressed by the interior decoration - the restaurant really is stunning and the designs are creative. It had a great atmosphere!  I chose to order the Quinoa salad (with greens, tomatoes, avocado, sweet potato, crumbled feta and seeds - mmmm) and added some chicken to it for $4.95. I thought the chicken portion was small considering the price paid to add it, but the salad as a whole was filling nonetheless.   I grabbed a few of their Piri Piri sauces - the garlic, medium, and hot - and tried each one with some of my chicken slices. All were really delicious and I liked the option to add more to your meal! I personally only like heat in moderation so my chicken was marinated in the Lemon & Herb Piri Piri flavour (your choice - it can go from mild to very hot) and I just added a bit of the sauce to it after. It was delicious.  I'd come back to a Nando's, but I've heard that the franchised locations aren't as nice as the corporate locations (which this one was). Something to keep in mind!

This review is strictly for service.    Nando's is a regular takeout spot for us.  We usually call ahead and it is ready about 15-20 minutes after calling it in.  We arrived within 20 minutes and after paying we were told it would be another 10 minutes.  The restaurant was surprisingly busy for a Tuesday evening.  We sat and waited for our order to be called out.  We waited and waited and waited.  After 30 minutes Mr Leny went to ask and discovered that our order had been sitting there the whole time.  Staff had forgotten to write PAID on the receipt so it was not called out.  By this time our food was cold so we asked for our money back.  The manager reluctantly issued a refund. We were starving when we got home and had to pull something out from the freezer for dinner.  Beyond annoyed and disappointed  Mr Leny said this was not the first time.  Management seems to have changed several times over the years and they never seem to be well organized. They really need to work on customer service.

This place was just newly decorated .  It is brighter and more modern looking with more space. They added an unlimited drink station which is a bonus. The chicken is very good and you can put your own level of heat. Live the rice and potato wedges for sides.  The family packs are a great deal for 3-4 people. Service is excellent but you tip before you get your food and I'm not sure if the money gets to the right people.

This place was just newly decorated .  It is brighter and more modern looking with more space. They added an unlimited drink station which is a bonus. The chicken is very good and you can put your own level of heat. Live the rice and potato wedges for sides.  The family packs are a great deal for 3-4 people. Service is excellent but you tip before you get your food and I'm not sure if the money gets to the right people.

It was my first time trying peri-peri so I thought I'd do some quick research.  Peri Peri (or piri piri) is the portuguese name for the African Bird's Eye Chili (which on further inspection, looks nothing like a bird's eye...or a bird...or an eye...).  And consequently, Nando's is a chain hailing out of South African where Nando's Peri Peri Sauce is a local celebrity.  This particular Nando's was recommended to me by a friend.  I was expecting a Taco Bell type of establishment but was surprised at the set up.  The design is very user friendly and the staff is very polite and all smiles.  The operation works with you making an order, being provided a number and then finding a comfortable seat to await your order to be delivered to you.  A very balanced fusion of restaurant and fast food.  The menu itself seemed simple enough, focusing on chicken and level of spice you want.  Either you can have a pita or a chicken plate.  The sides range from spicy rice to fries to salad, the regular assortment found at most establishments.  To the chicken...I didn't try the pita but my friend raved about it and the portion size (filling).  I had the quarter chicken (breast) plate with fries and a salad.  The chicken looked weird from the start (see picture), like an overgrown but scrawny chicken had wandered into nando's looking for what the big fuss was about this bird's eye chili, only to end up on my plate.    However, the chicken was great.  I got hot and like to think that over the years of force feeding myself hot chicken wings, I could handle a little spice...but that chili is HOT!  I sucked back my tears and ate my chicken, which outside of the heat has a great taste.  If you aren't big on spicy food, they have milder versions and also have some pretty good side sauces that can be applied (pictures).    Overall, I'm a fan.  The concept is simple, the location clean and the staff is friendly.  I look forward to discovering the other locations in the west end...

Got a Chicken dinner combo with beast , legs and skewers along with two sides to take home. The sides were the garlic mashed and the spicy peas. Waited around 25 minutes for the order. When we got the box , it seemed a bit small but on further inspection was rammed to the gills with chicken. The chicken was enough for two meals, including lunch the next day. The sides seemed a bit miniscule though. The mashed potatoes were good but I would not get the peas again.   Alas the whole shebang was $28.... at our local Churisco place back in the West End we could have got two sides and a whole chicken for $20...might be time to take the bike into little Portugal again ...

Heard amazing things about Nando's and finally had a chance to try it last Sunday. O.M.G. Amazing! The chicken is super tender, juicy and spiced perfectly. It is the best chicken I have ever had. Garlic mashed potatoes and peri-peri vegetables were so good as well.   The prices are higher than Swiss Chalet and portion sizes are definitely much smaller. We ordered 1 chicken sandwich, 1/4 chicken dinner with 2 sides to share. We were still hungry after dinner and had to get big mac's at the McDonald's near by.   The dining room is beautifully decorated. It's a nice cozy place to have dinner on a wintry night. The tables and booths are roomy and comfortable.   The servers were all quite friendly. But we had to wait 1/2 hour for quarter chicken dinner which I found strange as this is their signature dish. Perhaps just some kinks to iron out in their first month of operations.
This is a chain! The food and ambiance is great but a bit overprice.

Horrendous service - put in an order through Skip-the-Dishes - said it would be done at 5, show up and they can't seem to find the order, they say they're 'working on it', don't get the order until 5:45...ordered coleslaw, they give me peas...I mean sure, they're both vegetables but that's not really quite right is it?

I come to nandos to eat a couple times a year because they have really tasty chicken and good peri- peri sauce   My boyfriend and I ordered the double leg chicken plate and garlic bread with salad as well   The chicken size is a lot smaller than other chicken places but flavour is so good , they have different hotness levels and they all have great flavour.   We got glasses of water but the glass had so many water spots on it you would barely see through it. So I had to ask for new glasses.  Our garlic bread was brought to the wrong table and because the table started eating it we had to wait for more garlic bread.  The price is alright  The place has a really nice atmosphere, nice decor   Service was alright aswell

Nando's is great, the first time I went there I was confused as I was proceeding to sit down but I was flagged down by the waitress asking me to order and pay for my food before I sit down, it's a neat concept  The chicken is great and the garlic bread is amazing, also being a brown guy who loves spicy food (but honestly, which brown person doesn't?) I LOVE their hot sauce, it's actually hot! not like other hot sauces that peeps claim to be hot.  the staff is friendly and courteous also.  Will be definitely going there again soon with my better half.

The chicken is perfectly grilled and the Peri Peri sauce (especially garlic) makes it even better. The fries are delicious as well. The staff was quick and friendly. It's definitely my favorite restaurant.

Ordered take out from nando's one weekday for lunch. Shared the variety platter which included half a chicken, 2 skewers, 5 wings, and 2 sides (we ordered the peri peri fries and coleslaw). It states on the website that it is for 2 to 3 people, but I wouldn't recommend adding a 3rd person or you'll still be left feeling hungry. We requested medium spice, but ended up using their packet hot sauce which still did not bring in the heat as expected. Their peri peri garlic sauce reminded me of italian dressing. Although I'm a fan of chicken, I thought this order was only mediocre.
Never been disappointed with the food here.  If you like portobello and halloumi, I strongly suggest the sandwich. The veggie sandwich and chicken wraps were so-so in comparison.

The chicken is quite tasty here. The sides and desert are not bad either. Only problem with this location is, turnover is real slow and its small. I find myself getting takeout more often then I would like.

My boyfriend and I had the best experience here. The atmosphere was lovely and the food was delicious. What really made the whole visit was the service. The people here are the friendliest and will make your experience exceptional.  We ordered the chicken wings, fries, and quesadillas. All were delicious and hot and the selection of Peri Peri sauce really made the meal. For desert we got the Natas and unlimited frozen yogurt. The frozen yogurt was okay but the Natas were really great. If you don't know what they are (like us before the visit), they are Portuguese custard tarts that we both really enjoyed.
Came here for my first time. Loved it! Flavors were all there, cool atmosphere. Would return!

Good place.  Funny concept of ordering.  Chicken is really good like the good portuguese chicken places.  So I recommend.    Side dishes like the macho peas, mashed potatoes and veggies are good choice!  Enjoy!

This place has the CUTEST decor ever! I'm actually obsessed with it.  Also, the service is  fan-tastic.  Someone explained the entire menu and the restaurant concept (order and pay at the counter first and you help yourself to condiments, drinks, and utensils) when I sat down.  Two people came by halfway through our meals to see if everything was okay as well.  The food.  We had hummus with pita to start.  I love hummus so this was no different.  The portion is pretty small though so I probably wouldn't get it again.  We got the full pack share platter.  It came with the MOST oily delicious garlic bread.  Remember to eat these before they get cold and hard.  The large side of veggies was SMALL and flavoured poorly.  It also mainly had onions in it which weren't really cooked through so I didn't enjoy this at all.  The mash potato on the other hand great!  ok so the chicken.  It was pretty moist and had lots of flavour.  But I was hoping the skin would be crispy and instead it was kind of soggy. Who doesn't love eating crispy chicken skin right?!  Basically it wasn't anything outstanding that makes me in a hurry to come again anytime soon.

If I were to compare it to Swiss Chalet.. no Swiss Chalet sauce. Peri Peri seasoning which is spicy! I had the mild and my tongue could felt the heat. Pricing is per piece of chicken, then the option of one side or two sides. I had two sides so that cost $11.40 if I'm not mistaken.  Great space. Nice staff. Lovely interior design. Historically speaking this is where the old Cadillac dealership was.

I went here for dinner one night, and I can't say that this place is anything special. It wasn't bad, but for all the hype that people put around it, it's really not worth it.   When you walk into the restaurant, you immediately walk into the line-up where you pick and choose whatever it is that you want. I had a quarter chicken that was doused in the medium sauce and some wedges. I wasn't overly excited about any of the sides on the menu, so I decided to settle.   The chicken was pretty moist and the sauce definitely had a kick to it. I can take a lot of heat and I could definitely feel the hit on this one. The wedges were good. Crispy, sprinkled with some salt and paprika? I think, but overall, they were pretty good.  Again, this place wasn't horrible, but it also wasn't something that blew my mind. Would I go back? Only if I happened to be in the area.

I have to preface my review by saying Nando's is much better in England - the chicken is bigger and there are 7-8 varieties of sauces, which is what Nando's is all about!! Everybody loves it there, and the half self-service runs like a well-oiled machine.   It seems the Canadian ones are slowly improving, with wider menu options than before. I hope they follow suit with sauces.  Bay St is one of the fanciest ones I've been to, decor-wise, with all the beaded string action hanging above the booths, and a nice sectioned off area for a larger/private party. Plenty of seating for groups.  Food was fairly quick after ordering at the front, service decent, and probably one of the better ones in terms of flavour.   Always, always get your fries peri-peried!  And P.S. Yes, it is better than Swiss Chalet (across the pond, at least :P )

First - let's have a refresher: this Nando's is based on the UK version.  So, you get seated, then order at the front, grab your awesome soft drink from the Coke Freestyle machine, grab some cutlery and sit down and wait for your food.  I feel like some of these haterade comments are based on the fact people went in thinking it was a sit down restaurant in entirety, and that, it is not.  And never claimed to be.    So, now that he have that out of the way, my lunch was the bomb!  I had a Piri-Piri chicken sandwich, with Piri-Piri fries and sauce.  It was served promptly and tasted great!    Also, the interior of this place is awesome - really beautiful to look at.  I really enjoyed my lunch and it is much nicer than the first Nandos in the GTA back in the day in Brampton.  Give it a shot!  There's not much around the area that's good to eat!

The food here wasn't good at all. The meat was done right, but it just tasted like there was no flavouring. Even the flavoured rice tasted like plastic. There was about 3 veggie options, but they were mainly just wraps and sandwiches. The service was quick, we got all our food for 6 people in less than 10 minutes. The sauces they provide is okay, but not very flavourful and mainly tasted like hot sauce.

We visited for the first time for a lunch catch-up date and it was a great choice for us.  Located north of College/Bay, the restaurant is quite sizeable for prime real estate.  It's an open airy concept with warm and inviting decor.  You are seated, invited to order at the counter and then your meal is served to your table.  We ordered the 1/4 chicken meal with peri peri fries and coleslaw.  Chicken is crispy yet moist and very fresh.  Peri peri fries offer quite an edgy twist.  Coleslaw was a refreshing touch.  We enjoyed our meals.  Service was quite outstanding as we were promptly greeted; had the process explained as we were newcomers; and had a check-in midway through our meal.  I would recommend this place!

My friends and I are here after work.  It was a wonderful place to eat and beautifully decorated.  It was clean and it smelled so good inside.  I had a half chicken, with mashed potatoes and garlic bread.  The chicken was so juicy and tender the flavors of my chicken was finger licking good!  I love Nandos so much!  It is family friendly and there are many options to choose from.   Highly recommend this place to everyone.

I tried Nando's today for the first time not expecting much and it was surprisingly fairly good! I was under the impression that it was a lot like Swiss Chalet (which in my opinion, is very underwhelming and definitely not worth its price point) but to my surprise, while SC focuses on rotisserie chicken, Nando's was far superior with their flame-grilled chicken.  I say this because I ordered a lemon & herb quarter chicken leg with fries, and the chicken was so delicious. It was juicy, tender, succulent meat and you could really taste the flavours of their secret marination sauce infused throughout the entire piece of chicken. The fries on the other hand, by themselves, were just ok... not my favourite as I found them to be more hard/crunchy than light/crispy, but I gotta say I really liked the seasoning that they used!   A note if it's your first time coming here: the store concept is half-fast-food-half-restaurant. You have to go up to the cashier to order and pay, and you also have to get your own cutlery/condiments/tissues/drinks from little stations tucked away in the corners/sides of the restaurant. However, non-designated servers will bring your food to you and also take your dishes away after you're done (so you can gauge how you want to tip when you pay).

Even though I have been to the Home Sense and Marshalls close to this Nando's for so many times, I missed this nice Portuguese peri-peri Chicken place since it's open. What a pity!  The staff here are very friendly and explain how the order process works to me since I guess I'm looking so confused. If you choose to dine in, grab a seat first, go through the menu, go to the cashier counter to place and pay the order. Then all you have to do is wait until the server brings your food. Yep, like this simple. My problem is how much tips do I have to pay......Next time I'd better choose to order take-out. Then this won't bother me anymore lol  We choose a half chicken with Mango Lime sauce, plus salad and potato wedges as sides. The portion is great for two girls. There are various sauce options. Nice to try. My favourite is the garlic one.

Terrible take out process. Watched my food sit in the window for 10 minutes while I waited and watched it. Despite asking about it and being told it'll be longer than expected , then being handed the food I was watching. Won't be back

Finally made it here! 1 star for cleanliness 2 stars for service 5 stars for FOOD!  This was the best chicken I have had since I was in Jamaica a few years ago, so I was really impressed with the food. This place was a cross between African and Spanish. The Peri Peri sauce on the table is addictive and to die for if you like heat. Loved it and used about 1/4 of the bottle. The music playing was Spanish and that gets a star for sure.  The staff needed to care a bit more esp. about the washrooms (ick) and wiping down tables. Even when one gal came to wipe clean our table after asking her, it was still dirty. Otherwise the restaurant is really cute. You order at the counter, and grab a seat! The food comes out to you fairly quickly. I would get take-out next time and what we got, I would get again - chicken ( double legs and a 1/4 chicken), Spanish rice (deelish), Peri Wedges (OMG, hot and fresh, yummy!).You can take out a whole chicken for $18. Loved the Peri spice on the table too. I am glad we looked past the initial issues and stayed as we really enjoyed what we ate.
Totally hit the spot. Nice ambiance at the Bay St location. Nice Canadian VQA wine selection. I had the wrap - totally what I wanted - so good.

Love the peri peri spicy chicken! Got a full chicken and me and my girlfriend finished it!!  Their peri peri wedges are one of the best in towns! And the delicious tart to finish off a great meal! We will be back again!! Great service as well!!

Drove past this place a million time's and finally decided to stop and see how it was. It was great. Flame broiled Peri-Peri Chicken just made my top 5. The atmosphere was neat, they seat you with menu's and when your ready you order at the counter and they bring your food. The meal was delicious and the price was unbeatable. Flavors and tenderness of those beautifully broiled birds was fantastic. You can choose your level of heat from mild to face melting and I went with a medium that was just the rite amount of heat and flavor. The side's (Garlic Mash & Peri- Peri roasted veg) were also fantastic however next time I'll order Nando Size. (Because I'm a slob) Not alotof places in town that offer BBQ Chicken so if you get a chance be sure and stop by. You won't be let down.

I love Nandos as a franchise. The downtown location is extra special because the decor is really nice compared to other Nando locations, but the prices are still the same.  I've been to Nandos over 10x now. I always start off with the Portuguese bun. Then I order their extra hot chicken ( full chicken usually as I'm at Nandos with my family or girlfriend). We also usually get the chicken liver plate. I didn't know about this until recently , and now I get it every time we go there. Dipping the Portuguese bun into the liver is the secret !  We don't tend to get the sides usually. The sides are mediocre and nothing special. We usually just double down on the chicken itself and if I'm still hungry, I'd get an extra Portuguese bun because they are so damn good.  My favourite part about Nandos is how cheap it is. You can get a half chicken plat with two sides for less than $15! My family of four usually grab 2 full chicken $19 each , one chicken liver plate and a few Portuguese buns. The bill comes to around $15 to $20 per person after tax and tip !
We ordered 1/4 chicken leg and thigh take out, but it's totally burnt out. If you really want to eat here,  don't take out.

Iv had nandos chicken in several different location, Actually; in different countries ( South Africa and Namibia).  Even though the taste of the product is sub-par to what im used to in africa. Still amazing , but a little on the pricey side. There are plenty more Portuguese bbq joints in town with at par flavour and more authentic side orders. Nando's has become very commercial and has lost some of its authenticity.
I had a takeout order - waited about 15 min periperi half chicken. The meat is so tender & juicy!
Just tried this for lunch. Chicken was cooked right. It was delicious really. It's a bit like a fast food where you order in a line up but then they deliver the food. I liked it.

My guy wanted to go to this restaurant as he mainly eats chicken. We drove across town to go here especially. We each ordered a chicken piri sandwich and it was rather boring. Yes it was good chicken, but it's not difficult to make good chicken at home that has some heat. The fries were rather basic with piri dust sprinkled on top. Rather boring. It was expensive for what it was.
This place is five minutes from my work (dangerous) and I love coming here! Such a pretty location and the service and food is bomb. And on top of that, it's halal! So great.

Honestly I forgot how good this place was. This was my first time having Nandos since the summer. We were immediately greeted and at first, I was thrown off. There was never a host/hostess when I last came and there didn't seem to be a strict table service structure either. My friend and I sat at a booth after the table was quickly wiped. We ordered half a chicken of lemon and herb (spice is painful) with a side of Peri Peri fries and mashed potatoes.  Of course, we compared this to other rotisserie chicken places including Swiss Chalet and take-away whole chickens from your local grocery store. It was an amazing meal - perfectly cooked chicken with a light glaze. The sides were also seasoned nicely - nothing was overly spicy (the fries). Just to be experimental, I dabbed some pieces of chicken in the least spiciest hot sauce - the Garlic Hot sauce. Keep in mind I'm someone who finds kimchi and Sweet Chilli Heat chips spicy. I still survived and was content with my meal.  I was also contemplating getting a Portuguese tart however, they looked like they've beens sitting there for the entire day. If there was a way for them to reheat them, I would have purchased one or two but I've neglected to ask and was already pretty full from my meal.  Another thing I want to note is how the workers seemed very diligent. I find this to be a good sign as hard works usually pay off, and that is shown through the consistently satisfied customers (including myself).  Overall, the place portrayed itself as an ethical and positive workplace, which made my customer experience equally as positive.

Gluten-free review:  This place is great - delicious food, good atmosphere, cool decor, friendly staff. My go-to meal is the lemon herb chicken with garlic mashed potatoes and peri peri fries. A lot of carbs but worth it! The side of veggies are good too but their beans are just ok.   Downsides to this place are that there are no gluten-free desserts. They only have Portugese egg tarts. Also you have to line up and order instead of them taking your order at the table. It's quite awkward since they seat you and tell you to go up to order. So you have to have something to leave on your seat to "claim your spot" while you go up to order. At least they bring it to your table when it's ready, but still. Not cool.

This review is for the service only.  I love eating at Nandos, and have loved it for years. Since moving to the neighbourhood I was happy to see that there is a Nandos so close to me. I have ordered from this location many times and always had the same problem. It takes forever to get through to someone on the phone (many times I've given up) and when you do order it's not ready in the time that they say. I've also tried going in and ordering from the counter and waiting to take out and I always end up waiting at least half an hour. The food is great once you get it, but it just takes forever! It's much faster to just change your mind and order from another restaurant for dinner.  My advice is get some more staff if the location is that busy! And please put one person in charge of taking calls.
Wonderful Lunch! all 4 of us were pleased and will return and recommend this location! Patrick, the man in charge was friendly and helpful!

It's good food but over hyped. I've been eating Portuguese for years from Portuguese owned places and I like those better if I only compare the chicken. A lot of Portuguese places will use charcoal for their grilling, which adds a smokiness that Nando's lack.   Nando's does have its advantages. You can adjust the level of spiciness, and Nando's has more flavorful sides. Nando's has things a typical Portuguese restaurant might not have like wings or some African inspired stuff. But if I compare their main specialty - the chicken, I'd prefer most Portuguese places over Nando's.   This is especially true if I compare prices. Nando's is expensive and it's easy to see why. They spend so much on packaging. They have their Nando's paper take out bag. They have custom made take out boxes. They even have custom made sauce packets. A half chicken with 2 sides cost me $15.40 before taxes. At any Portuguese place, I'd probably pay 30-40% less, and the portions on the sides would be better. For this location, it's clear they spent a lot on decor too. As a foodie I don't really care that much about decor and packaging. I just want good food. Their food is good but when there's a price difference of 30-40% vs other Portuguese places, I definitely need to think twice about coming here. The taste isn't good or unique enough for me to justify paying this premium. Both Bairrada and Rooster King roast the chicken with more smokiness.

This was my first time going to Nandos. I have always wanted to go but there aren't much Nando restaurants near me.   This was the one that was half way from where I live. So I decided to call one of my friends and head on over. As we walked in, the place is super casual, I felt like I was overdressed (LOL). When we got in, the ladies at the front greeted us and directed us to our seats. Once we sat down, the waiter told us the options on the menu and when we were ready we could come to the front desk to order and pay. Which was different, I thought we would just order from the table. But anyway, we ordered Peri Peri Chicken Wrap with Peri Peri Fries and 1/2 Peri Peri Chicken with Fries.   We got our order within 6-10 minutes which was pretty quick. The fries and wrap were delicious not at all oily. I would come back to try other things on the menu :)

We traveled as a team of 25 people to Calgary and were fortunate enough to select Nandos as one of our meal options while there.  WOW!  Just a great experience for the entire team.  The communication from the Leslie was first class all the way, helping with menu options and having our meal ready and fully organized for pick-up when we arrived at the restaurant.  Now onto the food.  It was GREAT.  People raved about how good the chicken was.  And the sauces were perfect - familiar and exotic all at the same time.  The garlic mashed potatoes were delicious as were the rest of the sides.  Nandos is a place at the top of our list when we return to Calgary next year.  Thank you so much!

Nandos, everyone should experience this "restaurant" at least once( quotes because it's a little different from traditional restaurants, just go you'll see what I mean) chicken is full of flavour. nandos has a great peri-peri sauce, not over seasoned like other places that offer similar food. Garlic bread is also rather impressive, I know you're probably thinking it's hard to get that wrong, but you'd be surprised. If you're hungry, I recommend the half chicken with mashed potatoes. The mash is not overly salty and has a pretty even consistency. 4 stars because they changed the rice a few years back and I still haven't gotten over it.

Visited this location on a Thursday night. Had a bogo coupon for a quarter chicken + side. I feel this location is cozier and has a better atmosphere than the Markham Rd. location. The food is a bit tastier as well.  Food - 4.25/5 Ordered 2 quarter chickens with 2 sides (peri peri fries and garlic mashed potatoes) and 5 peri peri crusted wings. The wings were a bit on the salty side, but they were delicious and moist. I think if they served it with a lemon wedge to give it some acidity and cut the saltiness, the wings would have been perfect. The chicken legs were delicious as well, and the sides were good, but nothing special. I'm a big Nandos fan and enjoy most of their menu items. Love their chicken livers! All of their sauces on the chicken are good and you can add even more hot sauce/garlic sauce if you like, as they have a self serve section for sauces and condiments, cutlery, napkins etc.  Service - 5/5 There is very limited service at Nandos so they get a perfect score. How Nandos works if you're dining in is, you seat yourself and review the menu. When you're ready to order, you have to walk up the the cash, tell them which table number you're sitting at, place your order and pay. Then you go back to your table and they will bring your food to the table. Food came after a reasonable amount of time. Not much else to say here.  Value - 4/5 Prices are reasonable. I guess their biggest competitor is Swiss Chalet, which is a bit cheaper, but I feel like Nandos is slightly more higher end than eating at the Swiss. Nandos chickens are a bit smaller as well, but the flavours and taste are definitely way better. Overall, a good place for all things chicken whether you're dining in or taking out.
Love the garlic bread!! The chicken legs are sooo tender! Definitely will come more times

Those who are veterans of the Nando's experience will find themselves more than at home here.  The dcor is full of warm vibrant colours that provide a pleasant backdrop to the restaurant's Portuguese theme.  If you have never been to a Nando's before, then be sure to add this new location to your list of future eating establishments.   The simple and versatile nature of the menu is a welcome break from rigidly enforced culinary creations.  Their chicken is served in generous portions and it is cooked to perfection.  You have a choice of a number of different spice levels, ranging from fairly easy going to absolute mouth fire.  The Xtra Hot should only be attempted by the most avid spice enthusiast. Nando's has their own signature sauce, and it is as flavorful as it is spicy.  The fiery aroma comes as a welcome assault before the moist and prefect chicken can be enjoyed.  And enjoy it you will.  The South African owned, international chain has restaurants all over the planet.  Even as far as Qatar and Malaysia.  They are experts at grilling spicy, tender chicken for a growing audience that is completely enamored by their chicken.

Stopped in around 9:30 one evening. Was not greeted at all although a sign advised me to wait to be seated. Made my way to a cashier who showed me to a seat. Back to the cash to  order and pay and then back to my seat to wait for the food. Seems a convoluted system. Wonder how well it works at peak times?  Anyway, my 1/2 chicken with 2 sides came quite quickly. I then had to look for cutlery and napkins. Dispenser was out of both so had to get a staff member to procure them for me. Then I went to a machine to get my beverage. Might be smoother next time when I know the system.  No complaints on the food. Enjoyed the chicken, fries were crisp hot and nicely spiced and the coleslaw was standard. Ordered medium spice but could not detect much in the chicken. Did not seem like a big upgrade in food over something like Swiss Chalet and at a higher price point. Decor is nicer though. Cost around 20 bucks with tax and tip.

By far one of the few Portuguese restaurants that's great for dining in, not crazy expensive and casual enough to just drop in. Great food, wonderful atmosphere and plenty of street parking if you're early enough.

Well, I was there today for lunch. As a vegetarian I opted for the Veggie burger based on Chelsea K's review.  Sadly I didnt have as good an experience as she did.   A bit about the concept. You order at the register, they give you a number for your table and then deliver the food to you.  First the good: The restaurant had lots of nice banquette seating and was clean. The service was pleasant and relatively fast.  The bottles of Peri Peri sauces on the table was fun ( and tasty). The prices were reasonable. Now the not so good: Veggie Burger was very average... the bun it was on although very fresh was huge...far more bun that veggie patty.  The only toppings on the veggie burger were lettuce and a slice of tomato.   So essentially it felt like I was eating a bun with the rest as sort of an afterthought.   My friends had chicken and they thought it was good but one friend said  "You cant really screw up grilled chicken". That may or may not be true, but I was pretty underwhelmed by the whole  experience.  With the order at the counter concept and the quality of the food, it felt a bit like a  food court.  Chances are I wont be back. Sorry Nando.

Amazing chicken...but terrible service!  My last visit, the waitress spilled the coleslaw all over the table, my phone and my pants.  Accidents happen, but she didn't even apologize!  I was too hungry to care but I just thought that wasn't very good customer service.  The garlic peri-peri sauce made it all worthwhile....mmmmmmm.

The closest in atmosphere, taste and service you will find to the British Nando's. Look out for Vince, a fun personality and a great server! Thanks for making our experience great every time!   The food was so good we ate it for lunch and came back for dinner! Recommend this location to chicken lovers and workout fiends!  Flavourful chicken and quantity was definitely worth the experience.   After eating here I will never visit Markham and 14th Nando's!

I was excited to try this place with my friend because I heard great things. The interior looked very nice!! I attached some pics. I was confused about how the process works though. There was no host, but seating. We went up to the cash area and we're asked if we'd like to sit and said yes so we grabbed a nice seating area, and I sat and waited to be served, but I was told that there were no servers here, you order at the cash and then the orders are brought to you. It was interesting, and at first I didn't get if, but after I didn't mind at all. You can get your own refills whenever you want, etc. And then we got the food. O M G! I got the half chicken (two chicken breasts) with two sides (potato wedges and casa salad) the chicken, even though it was white meat, was FANTASTIC. Not dry whatsoever. The potato wedges and salad were nothing out of the ordinary but still really good! You can also take your own piri piri dressing (mild, hot, and garlic) but they're all quite spicy! Good thing I like spicy. Overall this place was nice, affordable, and absolutely delicious and I can't wait to go back!

We eat here about once a month! Although my child is a vegetarian we still fully enjoy the menu and I now have a new favourite item on the menu! The Holloumi cheese and portobello wrap! Best vegetarian dish I've ever had! I'm not one but it's so good that's what have.  But of course the chicken is amazing, and the Peri Peri sauce is why we come.  Usually, there is a line up, but don't be discouraged, it's worth the wait! Besides that should be a testament to how many people enjoy the food.    The structure was an old Pizza Hut, but about a year ago the remodelled and they must have hired a great designer because the facelift does not show any sign of the old "hut". Family dinning for sure, pretty relaxed. Never had an issue with the service, besides having to wait most times. But we love the food so much we know it's worth it.

Went for dinner last winter and was shocked that the restaurant had cockroaches, no wonder it's so dim in there! One ran across our table and my dinner party was immediately disgusted. It was embarrassing for me as I took this group out and it left a bad impression. I also spotted a roach in the bathroom, and when informing the staff about the situation they did nothing. The food was alright, the salad I had was bland and didn't have any olive oil, and the chicken and rice was decent. Not sure if they still have a roach problem at this location, but I won't be returning any time soon.

If you're hungry for grilled chicken, there's no other place to go but here!  Always a good time coming here! Wait time is fair, even when it's busy, your food comes pretty quick still! There are a wide variety of hot sauces to choose from! The last time I came here they just installed a new frozen yogurt machine! Although, it would be nice to have other options than just one flavour. They also had a new soda machine with lots of drinks to choose from, the darn machine has a touch screen with menu, crazy!  If you haven't been here before you should try it out! Fair price for lots to eat!

This Nando's has been recently renovated and looks much nicer than it did before.    Not all Nando's are created equal.  I have eaten at some terrible ones around the world.  I have also eaten at great ones.  This one is on the good side.  Their new cash point system is a little flaky so check your order to be  sure.. However the food is tasty and  the staff will hustle.  Perhaps my only complaint is something endemic to calgary.  When I ask for extra spicy, I want to feel the burn.

Was brought here by my colleagues and did not know how popular Nandos was.  Place is busy during lunchtime on weekdays and does not take reservations. We were seated very quickly though. Very cute dining room. Not luxurious but comfortable enough. Food was excellent. Quarter Chicken (leg & thigh) was juicy and tender here.   They take the orders a different way: you have to go to the counter and make orders, mention your table number, and they will bring food to you. I was bothered by the fact that they charge pre-tip in advance. I always tip but if I don't know what service I am going to get here, how should I determine the tip amount? I tipped 15% anyways. Great thing that all the staff we encountered were very attentive and polite. However I still find this pre-tip practice a bit counter-intuitive and may turn some people off.   To conclude I still enjoyed my experience here. Was just slightly annoyed by their tip practice.

I love Nando's periperi chicken!  The food here is delicious and consistent with other Nando's I've been to, including one in the UK.  Recommend their spicy periperi sauce if you can handle it. I love spicy food. Would probably just drink the sauce straight from the bottle if I could. Anyways it makes the chicken from good to good-er. Thumbs up.  Also along with ordering your chicken, make sure to try out some of their sides. I like the periperi fries and periperi potato wedges. But really, just anything with periperi is good.  Minus one point because the portion you get for the price you pay is whack - chickens are mighty small. However, the taste and periperi spices here are so good that you can ignore this and just go anyway.

Ever wondered what east african-portugese fusion would taste like? Ya either have I, but nandos proves that it is delicious. Nandos is flame grilled chicken served with a peri peri sauce (a sauce made with African bird`s eye chili).   The grilled chicken has a nice smokey flavour but what really elevates it is the sauce. They have sauces ranging from mild to extra hot. I usually go for the hot which has a nice lemony taste with a good kick from the chili. The sides are pretty standard (rice, salad, fries) I am a fan of their rice, and the peri fries are also quite good. My only knock against the food is that their portions are rather small, so if you have a big appetite like me go for the half chicken with 2 sides or a double leg dinner.   The place is very casual, you order at the counter, seat yourself and your food is brought to you once it is ready. They price is reasonable, you will end up spending 10-15 dollars depending on how much chicken and how many sides you wish to have. The restaurant itself is quite clean and modern looking (they had renovations done last year) and they have a few locations throughout the GTA. This place is definitely a good alternative to swiss chalet or any dirty bird franchise around.

Been to Nando's quite a few times. Everytime I get a hankering for some South African food (nostalgic) I drop by this Nando's location. And ever time, the service is slow. But it's really all about the chicken. And if you don't get hot or extra hot, I wouldn't hold it against you. I prefer mild (lemon garlic) since I like to taste what I'm eating without having to hose my mouth down. My favourite dish is the chicken liver with a Portuguese bun. Try it, you won't be disappointed. General observations: Order and pay at the counter. No biggie I suppose, but I always find it odd when the credit card machine asks how much tip you want to add, when they've actually haven't done anything for you yet.  You'll get a number which you can then take to your table and after a little patience, they'll find you and bring you your order. Good food once you actually get it!

PROS: 1. The chicken is smokey, spicy, juicy, and basically... to die for! The sides (potato wedges, salad) compliment the chicken as well.   2. I went to eat there after a loooong day at the Zoo, thus the food tasted immaculate. Perhaps biasing my review? Either way, it was still delicious!!  3. Atmosphere of the restaurant is like a hybrid of fast food and dine-in. I'd say it's good for casual eats but not a birthday.  CONS: 1. Service was not impressive. The cashier lady was pretty short with us and it seemed like she didn't want to be there.  OVERALL:  -I would definitely recommend it -Next time I go I'll buy a bottle of their sauce to take home -Much yummier than KFC

On a rainy and cold day last week, I had a mighty hankering for some roasted chicken that wasn't Swiss Chalet. So I went to its more exotic and better tasting brother Nando's for some takeout.  This was actually my first time trying their roasted chicken as I've always gotten the chicken livers (~$13) before. This is the only place I know that serves them in nice saucy chunks that you can soak up with some firm Portuguese buns. After reading some other reviews on how succulent the chicken was, I decided to give that a go this time around.   Because I am what people call "a baby" and I don't like mixing pain with food, I never get the spicy options. The Lemon & Herb half chicken (~$15 with two sides) had a pretty nice grill flavour on top but as with most roasted chickens, it gets kind of bland in the centre. Luckily, Nando's has got you covered with a myriad of Peri-Peri sauces. I was a big fan of the slightly sour, slightly spicy Garlic sauce. The meat itself was quite tender. As for my two sides, the Peri-Peri fries were really good with that garlic sauce and the grilled veggies were freshly prepared.   Unfortunately, the price to portion is not the greatest value even though it's quality chicken. For the price that is paid, there are better options out there. I heard they also recently raised prices. Another slight issue is the long wait. Even though we were getting take out, it took a good 30 minutes between the order and us leaving the restaurant. The food was really fresh so it wasn't the biggest problem but I do suggest you call ahead, especially at dinner time.   Even with the small problems, every time someone says chicken, I'll say Nando's! Their food is fresh, hot, and pretty tasty. But next time, I think I'll stick with those fantastic chicken livers.  (45/100) - 2016

I've been to this Nando's location twice and was satisfied with each visit.  The seating arrangment is vast and plentiful, they have an ammazziinngg drink machine, and many varieties of sauce flavours to add to your meal.  During my latest visit,  I ordered their whole wheat chicken wrap. It was good; tasted like there was some sort of honey mustard sauce, contained a variety of chopped veggies, and all white chicken breast pieces. After having a bite or 2, I felt the wrap needed a little more flavour,  so I decided to add a bit of the garlic piri-piri sauce which made it much tastier! I ordered a side of their piri-piri friea as well which were very tasty!  I also tries their mashed potatoes (would highly recommend)  and their potato wedges (I've definitely had better potato wedges in my life).   I will probably return sonetime next year.... Not something I'm dying to come back to.  Very Good, but not great.

Good food. Nice location and plenty of parking spots. And hot sauce bottles overload! The restaurant itself is not that big, but it can accommodate a big group if it's not crowded already. Food arrived fairly quickly and staff was nice. Great overall!

Came here for a birthday dinner on Friday night. We were a party of nine and could not reserve a table, but my friend managed to snag one of the cooler tables with colourful bead curtains. Great location as you're only a block away from College Station; I was going to drive initially, but opted to ride the rocket instead. The ambiance is quite casual as it's cafeteria style. Once you decide on what you want, you up to the counter and order your meal.   The menu is quite extensive and there's something for everyone. A little random, but they have all you can eat froyo on their menu. After looking at the menu, I decided on the double chicken skewers (2 sticks) with two sides (veggies and garlic mash). I've been spoiled with authentic mom and pop Portuguese chicken so I found my meal to be a-ok. Portion size was not too big; considering their specialty is chicken, I found it to be quite dry. My sides were also okay; they were a little salty. I thought the bottomless pop from the machine was pretty neat; you can choose any pop with various flavours .... Orange Coke, Cherry Coke, Raspberry Coke etc.  For a casual dinner with a group of people, Nando's is a good choice. Everyone can eat chicken.  Good for: groups, casual dining
Food was good but service was terrible. Ordered take out they lost my order and clearly saw I was standing there for about 15 minutes while customers behind me were getting there food
It is a must do. Health food and an unique mix of South African and Portuguese spirits. Music is great.

came here for the first time through a recommendation of a friend  the interior of the restaurant is very cute and colourful and the lounge is comfortable to sit in  never being here before I found out you have to order at the front and grab sauces that you want that I found unique  I got the medium heat 1/4 chicken and my boyfriend got the lemon and herb one we also got Cajun fries and pop at first   when it arrived it was what I expected but a little smaller but my boyfriend said it was a very small  portion for what he paid and proceeded to rant oh my . he went to order rice as well. then he came back and said the cashier was rude because he seemed like he was half asleep and didn't know the answers to his questions.   the food arrived quickly. the rice was very unique different than any other rice I've tasted. it was yellow and had some veggies and a harder texture I would give the rice 3/5 as it was just average   the Cajun fries were yummy and thick cut. had a nice Cajun spice to it to give it a good flavour 3.5/5 better than average   the chicken was super good. it surprised me how moist it was and the skin fell off the bone. the sauce and spice was perfect and had a tangy flavour. the lime one was more sour but still had that kick of spice. I find it interesting that they put sauce on a chicken but have lots of sauce at the front. perhaps you should get the plain chicken then you can add whatever sauces you want yourself. overall the chicken is a 4/5 because it is quite expensive for what you get   overall I would recommend this to people who can handle spice as it gets spicier the more you eat and like chicken. also you can use SPC if you have it but I forgot to use mine  would I come here again? probably but only once in a while by boyfriend said he is never coming again tho hahah

Went for an office team lunch to this place that is just a block away.  They weren't able to keep their promise of sitting us all at the same table when we made reservations earlier in the week.  This is because their tables are bolted down.  The grilled chicken was the highlight as advertised and combined with their wide selection of puri-puri sauces are really tasty but I would stay away from the grilled veggies and stick with getting the more traditional sides such as mashed potatoes and corn.  The puri-puri sauces get real hot, real fast so be careful and don't overestimate your tastebuds. :)  The grilled puri-puri veggies were overdone and felt like they had been sitting in a pan for a while.  Drinks are dispensed from the all-in-one super Coke machine which is kind of neat.  The restaurant atmosphere has a lot of african art and knick-knacks and the seating arrangement is a mix between sit-down conversation dining places to the food-court type seating for quick power lunch meals.  This spot is more suited for power lunches during the weekday from work and less for a long dinner.

Honestly, if I was rating the food, it would be in the 4 star range. It was pretty tasty I have to say.  I ordered a lemon & herb whole chicken with peri peri fries. SO TASTY. Chicken definitely tasted "flame grilled" and the fries were hot, crisp and flavourful. Really good.   The main problem is the atmosphere/the location itself. Came here for dinner, and immediately when you walk in, it was pretty hectic. The restaurant itself is kind of small. There's a mix and match of different kind of seats; one side booth seating, curvey corner booth couches, cloth seats and metal chairs.   Since this is a "eat with your hands" kind of place, anything cloth is stained and nasty. My seat was pretty gross; it had seen some better days. I don't get why they don't just use all metal seats so you can wipe and clean things up better? Booth seats are the vinyl material so I guess they're clean-ish. Also there are no napkins you can get yourself - you have to ask for them???... Guess that's why the seats are dirty.   Maybe it was just because I went and had bad luck, but the other patrons that come here, that looked like they've been here before made the experience a little worse...You've got some late teenagers/super early 20 something year olds talking loudly about credit scores and their grand plans for their future/get successful quick schemes, a family with like 8 kids (I'm not kidding I think I only saw 2 adults, and the rest were children), and other people kind of standing around clueless watching you eat/letting their kids run around.   Overall, good food, could use a good cleaning, and bad crowd.

I was well happy in the car with my friend Terry as I thought we were heading to my favourite Pho place for dinner. As we were nearing the restaurant though, Terry turns and says "How about we try Nandos?". I hesitated for a moment but then agreed (I used to have Nandos once a week back in Australia so I assumed I was in for a treat).That ended up being a terrible decision.  My chicken sandwich was bland and flavourless, the fries were OKAY at best. Terry offered me some of his wedges and they were drier then the Sahara Desert.  I would not eat here again and any Australians/English people reading this review and thinking "I wonder if Nandos tastes the same in Canada as it does back home?"   It doesn't

My friend Libby recommended Nando's.  She enjoyed the food at Nando's Chicago during a recent trip.  I was in Toronto and found out that there were several Nando's in Ontario.   The restaurant is Portuguese with southeast African influences. The peri peri spice comes from the African birds eye chilli. The first nandos opened in Johannesburg in 1987. The decor of the restaurant is South African to pay homage to their roots.  The decor was interesting and comfortable.  The South African motif definitely put me in the mood to enjoy the Peri Peri Chicken.  I ordered the quarter pound Chicken with Wings and Breast.  I selected the Spicy Rice and Nando's Vegetables for my sides.  The Chicken was moist and definitely flavorful.  I alternated between dipping the Chicken in the medium hot and extra hot Peri Peri sauce - available to grab and bring to your table.  The sides complemented the Chicken well.   As a dare, our group also ordered the Roulette Chicken wings - at least one or more of the Chicken wings is super spicy.  It was fun to see who got the super spicy wings.  Nando's was great for lunch.  Good food, great decor and a fun element to share with friends and family - Roulette Chicken.  Nando's also had a few decent veg options for friends and family who do no partake in Chicken.  I definitely recommend Nando's as a fun and interesting place for lunch or perhaps dinner.

Came in here to try. But never coming back again. Especially after the price we paid for such a small amount of food. Not worth it. Go to Churrasco Portugril and try them instead.  If it costs 30$+ for such little food, I can put my money towards a better meal.

I gotta say, I love Nando's and I love their peri-peri sauce even more! It's hard for me to go anywhere else in this plaza when I know Nando's has some gooood chicken just waiting to be eaten!  They have some great combos as well... "Meals to Share." My usual order is: Variety Pack - 1/2 chicken, 2 kebabs, 8 wings and 2 regular sides OR Nando's Familia - 1 chicken, 2 kebabs, 1 large side, 1 reg. side and 1 large salad WITH an extra side order or 2 of peri peri chips, coleslaw, corn and baked potato. (minus  whichever is ordered with the meal).  Devan is right when he says its overpriced for what you get, the value could definitely be better - but loyal Nando's customers don't mind. I usually spend about $40-50 for two people here for a seriously satisfying meal. Definitely not the greatest value, but for me an amazingly satisfying meal. I think they put something in their sauce. Once I start I just can't stop.

Why haven't I come here in so long, and why haven't I written a review for this place yet?  So when someone mentions Nando's to me, it usually brings up pretty fond memories of dining my family and with my friends in Dubai. This place is a huge chain that's peppered through East Africa and the Middle East. Flame Grilled Portuguese chicken married with east african bird's eye chili's..for the masses (so it's not super spicy.) (I once had a really horrible experience with the bird's eyes that involved me not being able to take my hands out of ice cold water for two days)   Anyways, past time's I've been here I've been really underwhelmed. The Canadian version is missing a few key elements that I'm used to, but that can just be attributed to the fact that Dubai does everything way over the top.  Anyways, I came back here a few days ago with my friend who really had the same memories I did, and wanted to check it out.  We decided to get the sharable plate for 2 (or 3 I guess) which had  1) The Whole Chicken - I guess they use the term "whole" quite loosely, but it came with two leg quarters and two breast pieces. The legs were really good, but I was sooo surprised with the breasts! They were PERFECTLY juicy and stuff. OMG. I was expecting  dryness because honestly I don't think I've ever had bbq breast that wasn't dry. SO GOOD. We ordered it medium because my friend was scared, but it wasn't spicy So good though.  2. Large Side - We got the peri peri fries. It was really good fries tossed in a peri peri salt. Yummy.  3. The Garlic Bread - SO GOOD. It may look like a small portion from the pic but that's because we devoured half of them before the other food came. SO GOOD.  4. The sauces were AMAZING. My favourite was the Xtra Hot and the Garlic Sauce. Soooo good.    This place is a lot better than it was before. There were a lot more serviers and people working this time than what I remember, so I guess business is booming! They had a pretty steady stream of customers while we were there (around 6.30 on a Thursday night)  We were definitely full for the rest of the day.  Will defo be back  (We paid approx 32 with tax + tip sans drinks)
Over priced swiss chalet with hot sauce. Nvm, I actually like Swiss Chalet chicken better.. and ooooh the gravy.
Kind of like swiss chalet. the sauce was the highlight. I ended up buying a bottle of sauce so when I made my own chicken I just pour some of that on top. yum.

I imagine their chicken here is quite good, but as I ease into full pesco-vegetarianism I actually just ended up ordering the veggie options for my partner and me. We were both super disappointed with Nando's tonight for 2 reasons-  1. They ran out of so many ingredients and veggie options. The corn was not available, but understandable since "out of season", but they were also out of grilled pineapples, the veggie sandwich, and the "portobello mushroom with halloumi cheese and chilli jam" sandwich. So my partner ended up ordering his 3rd choice - the veggie wrap - and upon delivery of the food he was told that they also ran out of one of the vegetables that is usually in the wrap. Please stock up your inventory soon, Nando's.   2. The veggie options sucked. I don't think I have super high standards for food, not a food snob or anything, but the sad presentation/discrepancy from advertised photos and oil drenched, flavorless grilled veggies were truly disappointing. I ordered the quinoa salad, which looked amazing in a few existing Yelp photos, but tonight it was so sparse and sad looking :( There wasn't enough seeds on top and overall the quantity was much smaller than it appeared in the photos. The toppings also looked sloppily chopped and presented. I could've easily made this salad in 2 minutes myself.  The upsides-  1. No issues with seating immediately after arriving since the restaurant is so large (they also have huge communal tables -- great for groups!) 2. Friendly service 3. Relatively fast for food to arrive -- we had to wait around 15 minutes, which I guess is not bad considering the volume of customers

Coming back from Nando's just now, Nando's is a great place to go to up until you get a table for 6 and while you wait for your friends to arrive while already ordering a beer and looking at the menu sitting at my designated table 20, a rude waitress comes up to the table and RUDELY ask "when is your other guest coming" and you respond "soon" followed by her condescending "You can't do that" with her almost threatening to take my table away with a "I'll come check on your table again soon" in an unprofessional manner that I deem condescending and rude. I understand that the place was getting packed but for a waitress to threaten to take my table away (while I was ALREADY drinking a beer AND I was there because I wanted to make sure I got a freaking table) made none of the food for me taste one bit good because her mannerism literally overshadowed anything I have to say good about the venue. Heard great things about the place but came that Friday night, was unimpressed at the hospitality. As an SEO Specialist, you can bet I will be posting more negative feedbacks across many mainstream review platforms.

Staff: "hello! have you been to nando's before? First of all, I've been to Nando's more than you've been to Nando's.  Nando's is a great spot for grilled chicken - basically a swiss chalet that doesn't taste like overpriced shit. Having been to better nando's location, I found this one extremely chaotic and dirty. The atmosphere just didn't do it for me, even for a chill meal spot. The restaurant looked like a bunch of restaurants put together, none of the decor/chairs/booths matched. The back looked like a babysitter's club. I like the individual washrooms though they were a bit dirty as well. The chairs looked like someone had a very rough time on them. Cloth chairs and no napkins aren't a great combo anywhere.. stains from who knows how long ago. Kind of unappetizing.. good thing I only saw that at the end..  This nando's was very populated/busy - many people in and out every few minutes, mostly for takeout. Then more things to ruin the atmosphere.. such as this large trashy family with probably 2 adults dragged around 8 toddlers in and demanded to be seated all together, even when the manager said "even when the restaurant is empty, we don't have a table for 10" .. whose mans brings in 10 people to ANY restaurant without calling in first and demands to be seated. Lucky us- they got seated next to us and we had screaming, sticky children kicking and running around for half our meal. It's a very family-oriented restaurant so expect a bunch of that.  In terms of service, we had to ask for water/napkins.. basics. Other than that, food came quickly and they were generally nice. We ordered the classic shareplatter which came with a whole chicken, a large side (peri peri fries) and garlic bread. Carb overload!!! Most of their sides include an abundance of carbs - even the vegetables (c'mon.. corn??) so beware. The fries were crispy, hot and fresh.. it was a bit salty but definitely a great cheat snack! The chicken however- best. Sooooo good, grilled so it's extra lean and an easy way to get in that protein for the day. It had so much flavour in every bite and definitely worth it. We dipped it in the garlic sauce, which was great and hella spicy. 10/10 would get again.  I also saw on the menu that they had bottomless froyo.. I think the machine was broken though- but that is DANGEROUS! Definitely want it.
Boring. You get grilled chicken and some sauces. Might as well get a rotisserie chicken from safeway and buy the nando hot sauces. Save you a lot of money.

Last Saturday was our first and last visit here. The staff doesn't have a service model that they can excel with in the first place, (i.e., sit down, be told to look at the menu and then go to the cash and place your order, go over there and get your cutlery, get a glass and get water if you want water) but it would have been nice to be told after waiting and asking 3 people for the drink I'd ordered that they had 'forgotten'  that I had to make a third trip to the cutlery station to get dressing for the salad they'd just plunked down. The manager or head server tried to make up for it by offering us free pastries - we didn't want pastries. We just wanted to be served what we ordered and informed ahead of time about getting our own dressing and condiments. The salad wasn't fresh and the chicken was dry. Zero training and concept about focusing on the customer's experience - what does the customer really want, not what Nando's thinks they want, it appears. I'm already wondering what will replace it in this space.
Perfectly done Chicken. Peri peri livers extra well done was perfect. Better than back home in SA. Chicken is done from scratch. Not dry. Flavourful! Great service and friendly staff.

I have been to this location twice. I have tried the grilled chicken livers and half chicken. It tastes good and authentic. My only problem is with their service and portions. They can work on a better service and cleanliness. Overall worth a try.

Pretty decent place if your looking to eat somewhere casual but not as casual as fast food. They have good grilled chicken with of course their famous peri peri sauce. The portion of the plates are inadequate for it's price.. For a half chicken plate with two small sides cost about $20.  The extra hot peri peri sauce is extremely hot for those spice lovers! Definitely a place to try but not sure if it's to die for!

I've tried Nandos a handful of times and always thought the food was good, but a fairly small portion for the price.  It wasn't until I tried the double lime and mango skewers that I changed my opinion. I find it's the best sized meal for the money and is the only thing I want to order off the menu.  I went to Nandos at Bay and College last week to find that my one favourite thing to order had not been delivered that day due to a problem with their supply chain.  The manager was close by when I was attempting to order an offered some of the best customer service I've had in a resturant in a long time. They helped me pick something else out that was similar. I ended up having a chicken breast and a side and was very happy with my food.    I still think the prices are a little high for the portions, but good customer service and delicious food keeps bringing me back to this location.
Amazing atmosphere and food! Just delicious and I love how you can choose your level of spiciness. I miss working in the Northeast where this location was convenient.

Had take out from Nando's yesterday. The 2 chicken legs were nice and spicy (ordered that way) and stayed hot. The rice pilaf was excellent, although just a bit overcooked...the grain had swollen too much. But the chicken is excellent....I wondered what it would taste like cold.....  This is now my 'non-fried' "chicken of record". Tasty!

Don't get the green beans, they made me cringe on impact with my tongue. Lets just say they love their mint.  The chicken was OK...thank the lord its not an arm and a leg because you could taste the flame & propain more then their great spices on the chicken. I had to baptize the thing in sauce.   The staff is very friendly on the plus side and the place has a great vibe inside. Not the number one choice for me moving forward, however.

Always great! Delicious peri peri chicken. Huge portions and hearty food. Everything is self serve-get as many sauces as you want! Service is super fast. One of my favourite places to come with a big group.

I really wanted to love the chicken but it was dry and all the flavour came from the sauces you had to grab from the side counter. However, the biggest turn off was the lack of clean utensils at the side counter and there was literally no one you could flag down or speak to at the cash register regarding replenishing.
I don't understand why anyone would come here for chicken...... it's so plain and dry and poorly done......

My boyfriend lives next to it so we are always here always super busy but fast. I love their chicken pita, their mashed potatoes and the rice. The natas are okay but the nandos kisses chocolate ice cream is pretty good. You can get any kind of coke (cherry/vanilla, etc). They sell a really good Ros wine ! Also they serves are very friendly and Carmen was really helpful with her advice.

Oh my goodness Nando, where have you been all my life?!  I needed to go downtown with a coworker today for a meeting so we popped in here for lunch first. I've heard about Nando's from following The Body Coach on Instagram but just assumed it was a U.K. chain.   We arrived at approximately 12:30pm and although the restaurant was busy, we were seated quickly at a long, family-style table. The decor was kinda funky and extremely inviting.   We both opted for the Quinoa Salad with Peri Peri Chicken (add-on) and headed up to the counter to place our orders.   After grabbing our cutlery and drinks we head to our seat to wait for our food. It wasn't long before we were presented with the most beautiful and delicious looking salad!  A few bites in and I knew we'd picked a winner! My lunch companion had been to Nando's before so she knew to grab the extra bottle of Peri Peri Garlic Sauce. OMG. And I thought it couldn't get any better!! I think our stomachs were high-fiving each other!  The service was great, the food was fabulous and I can't wait to come back!!

Although it's not the same as the locations in London, UK the food is still very good. The location is decorated in a very fun way and it is a fun place to sit down with friends and family. The staff have been friendly also the times I've visited this Calgary location.

First time eating here on Saturday and the place was impressive in size and seating. Not bad on the interior decor too. Anyway the food was good! I loved the peri peri chicken and fries! A must order! But I must say, if your eating with someone, just get the whole chicken instead of ther 1/2. Better in price wise and portion.   I would definitely go back again!

I've been here both with a big group and just me and my hubby and there seems to be a difference in the quality of the chicken between the two.   With a big group we always get the 1/4 chicken (leg and thigh) lemon herb with the Portuguese garlic bread, Casa salad with oil and vinegar and spiced rice. We order and pay at the cashier then they deliver the food to our table. The chicken has always been hot, juicy and flavorful while the sides complemented the chicken well in taste and freshness.   Eating here with my hubby we ordered the 1/2 chicken (which was actually two 1/4 chickens) with lemon herb which was a little on the dry side but still tasty. For the sides we had the appetizer platter with the roasted red pepper dip which came with pita, 3 grilled wings (tender and juicy) and the Portuguese garlic bread. The red pepper dip was salty but the garlic bread which was grilled was delicious. The bread was even better when dipped in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.   TIPS:  Come with a large group   If you come with a small group order the 1/4 chicken (leg and thigh) or wings to make sure your chicken is not dried out.  For sides, get the grilled Portuguese garlic bread (make sure to dip it in some oil and vinegar), Casa salad with oil and vinegar and spiced rice.

Surprisingly enough, when we came here on a Friday early evening, there were still a few tables left for our group of 4. After getting seated, you choose what you'd like from the menu, then go up to the front to order and pay. We ordered the family pack so that we'd all get to try a few different things from their menu. It was around $40 for a chicken, 2 skewers, 2 large sides and garlic bread or 2 Portuguese buns.  The food came relatively quickly and we didn't notice this until a few hours after our meal, but our family platter was missing the 2 chicken skewers. For the peri-peri sauce, we chose plain since someone in our table didn't eat spicy foods. The peri-peri vegetables were subpar, with lots of onions in it. The garlic bread was delicious and the potato wedges were seasoned perfectly. The chicken itself was very tender, juicy, and well seasoned.  The place itself was very loud, possibly because it was a Friday night. There isn't really service, since you don't have a set server throughout the meal. Was quite disappointed about their missing food (the skewers), but I might come back another day to try it another try anyhow.

Loveeeeeeee this place. Specially this location.  I HATE CHICKEN LIVER.     I have tried it in soo many different way possible and still hate the texture. But when i go to Nando's all i order iS LIVER. OMG i dream about the taste sometimes hahahhaha so lame i know i know. But its the most delicious thing i have tried.

very poorly run business. came here for lunch with my employees. They had no veggies. coffee machine was broken. the draft beer was also broken. Wi-Fi didn't work. when i travel i depend on yelp to enjoy my vacation so I just want to let people know my experience. stay away !!!

I came to Nando's with two coworkers during lunchtime on a weekday. You go up to the counter to order, but servers assist you with seating and bring your meal to the table. It's a very casual setting, and quite fast.  I really, really like the chicken (not dry at all) and the spicy rice. I am also a big fan of the sweet potatoes. They have a variety of sauces (different spice levels) which are good.

First time there. Went for take-out at supper time.  Too long a wait for my order to be taken. Too long a wait to get my order. When I got home, I was shocked and disappointed upon opening the meal containers.
