They must buy their chicken from a former Nazi concentration camp judging by the amount of meat on the leg and thigh I was given. The garlic mashed potatoes amounted to about three mouthfuls. OK.... you got me this time, Nando's but you will never get me again.   I am not interested in food that is burnt because eating charcoal is not good for you.  I fail to understand the rave reviews for a fast-food place that delivers so little for far too much money.

Great food. The chicken sandwich was really good and the lemon and herb spice was really flavorful. Really hits the spot. Nice decor too. Would have been 4 stars except...  The service was terrible. I was alright with paying upfront including tip, though I was hesitant how much to tip because I hadn't gotten the food yet. However, the waitress charged us $1 more on a combo for no reason whatsoever. They also offered pineapple and cheese on the sandwich and never mentioned that they were each an extra dollar.  Would come again for the food, but definitely not worth it for the bad service.

Horrible service. Worst Nandos location in the entire Toronto. First they screwed up our order, made us wait for over 20 minutes and then started yelling at us because we were getting anxious. The manager tried to cover up for it later by offering free coupons but my appetite was gone by then. Go to any other location but not this one.

Except for the immediate barrage of questions upon entering, (are you staying or going? Where will you be sitting?), this was a lovely experience. The quality of the food is certainly excellent, and the price is also very reasonable. Staff are helpful; I like to get as much bang as possible for my buck, and the man who took my order was helpful in finding out how many ounces of meat were in each dish we discussed. Looking forward to a return visit, and recommending to my friends!

What is it about this place that excites people so much? I like chicken, I like marinaded chicken, I like spicy chicken...but this place didn't impress me. I had the peri peri chicken wrap with fries, it was medium peri. NOT spicy at all, if you want something with a kick go for the hot.  My wrap/pita was 6.50 and i didn't think it was worth the money at all.  On top of everything, there was very limited seating, with no space to even stand by the front counter. I don't mind busy restaurants but this one was just awkward, i didn't know which way to move because right or left I would have ended up molesting a child or an older person accidentally (?)....  Next time I will definitely order a whole chicken or something because the wrap wasn't enough, I would have gladly gone for McDonald's after this!   PS they have beer...if you like to casually wash your chicken down with some brewski :D

I used to go here back in the late 90's after highschool basketball practice. My palette was a little less refined at the time, but I use to love their chicken and the hot sauce that it came with.  Fast forward to over a decade later, a Nando's restaurant has just opened at College and Bay. I had to go check it out and see if it still stacked up to the memory I had of it.   Since my highschool days, I've had Churrasqueiras from many restaurants in Little Portugal, and the real deal when I travelled to Lisbon, so it didn't come as a surprise that Nando's wasn't as good as I remember, however, it wasn't bad. The sauce isn't as good as authentic peri peri sauce, but the chicken was very moist, and cooked perfectly. So, if you're in the college park area, and you need a quick fix of roast chicken, it'll do in a pinch. It's better than swiss chalet, or a chicken you'd get at Longo's.

I remember Nando's from my days in Vancouver. I remember it being this succulent, spicy chicken.  While the restaurant is very big and can accommodate groups, the food is a disappointment. Tiny chicken pieces. Dry chicken. Not as spicy as desired (even though you select the spice level) and the spice, on the other hand, overly spicy!  Now that I have piri piri at home, I can make my succulent, spicy chicken. Buh-bye Nando's!
Chicken was tasty You have to get up to order and get your own silverware and whatnot. Not a problem- but you should know.
Gave 2 stars cause of the food. Service was horrible and staff seemed to have attitude. Kept subtracting from the tip, Not coming back here again 2 thumbs down

Great place for lunch! I absolutely love chicken and they have these booths where you have beads dangling over top you.   I wouldn't necessary come here all the time, but it's easy to make reservations for a large amount people.  Their chicken is tender and their sauce is ... there are no words. If you like spicy (and REALLY like spicy) then this place is for you. You can either get your chicken milk, hot, or really hot, or you can add the hot sauce yourself.   They also have unlimited drinks and frozen yogurt for dessert (which I still have yet to try and eat a tub).  It's also one of those coke machines that have all the different flavors you think no body would try, but you would end up trying them.  I would recommend this place for a large group of people as it has an amazing ambiance, but not for a date. Still love the chicken (AND HOT SAUCE).
The food taste good, and the staff are very polite and friendly but the restaurant is not clean. Food rests on the tables, floor and the washrooms dirty.

Yay it's Nandos!  When I was new to this area, I went almost weekly... My appetite increased the more I came. You start at 1/4 Chicken, then 1/2 Chicken, and basically end up ordering a whole chicken for yourself! Hehe:) Nowadays, I visit occasionally. The ambience and decor is much better than Swiss Chalet. Spacious with lovely cozy booths. I've been here with larger groups (16 ppl) and they were very accommodating.  The chicken is alright... It's the sauces that make it yummy!!! Make sure you cover it in your favourite sauce, you'll be bringing bottles to your table. As for side dishes, peri-peri wedges or fries are best. The rice is good. I find the coleslaw over dressed. I stopped liking their mixed vegetables. The wrap is pretty good too.  It is definitely a go-to spot if you're in the neighbourhood.   Tip: Peri-peri everything!! Your fries, your chicken, get it all.  Extra savvy tip: Once, I was here with some friends who decided to pack their chicken bones home, to make chicken broth.

I have been to this Nando's thrice now, and all three times the service has been excellent, the staff are very friendly, and the service is quite speedy. Their chicken is very flavourful as well as their sauces, sometimes a bit too flavourful for my personal taste. Their Nando's Kisses is a great time if you like your sweets like me. The atmosphere is very casual, great with friends. Overall, I would definitely return and recommend this location.

The decor is pretty unique, and the location is really easy-access. The price is reasonable, and the service is great. The main menu gives you a good variety of taste, spice, and food to choose. There are also few options for dessert which are not very appealing though.

Came here late night on Sunday. It was my third visit to this place. We ordered a whole chicken and fries and mashed potatoes to share. The chicken was good - soft and tender however the fries were measley for $3.80 and tasted like it's been sitting out all day.

Folks who go to Nando's love the sauce. Once you go in there and take a bite, you are hooked to it. My wife and I are fans of this place. The food (chicken breast, the corn, the sweet potatoes) are petty nice. What I really hate about this place is the service. The left over plates stay on for a long time, the folks are unaware about where you are sitting. The washrooms are messy. I ordered a coffee too and they forgot about it. I am not sure if the reason for this poor service is because they charge you for food first (including the tip). I personally feel that this does not incentivize the staff. At one end, the management want to make it a sit down restaurant and on the other extreme, they want you to place the order like a McDonald or Tim Hortons. I am returning to this place? Yes, for sure. I just want to make sure that the readers are aware of the expectations. The

I tried this place a little while ago.  I ordered the wrap and was very disappointed with what I got.  It was puny and definitely not worth the price.  I ended up eating half of what my gf ordered.  The chicken is good, but I don't think we'll be going back.

I've been into this Portuguese inspired restaurant/take away several times, typically for a late weekday dinner with the family. It has always been a consistent choice and I've found the chicken to be a very good value/portion for the price. The chicken is always fresh, moist and tasty and the standard sides are a good apron to the chicken. I do, however recommend coming here with at least a couple people so that you can share a whole chicken and some sides.

One of my favourite restaurants when I travel, there are over 1000 locations world wide, and you can never go wrong with Nandos, a African/Portuguese restaurant known for grilled chicken in various marinades, and accompanied by some flavourful hot sauces, and a choice of lots of sides, I always get a platter for 2 to 6 people, the chicken comes in different spice levels, and grilled to perfection. The sides my family really likes are the peri fries, garlic bread, corn on the cob(seasonal) and I get the chicken livers in extra hot for myself. Not a fan of chicken livers anywhere, but love the ones at Nandos. And the side sauce that is the best is "Garlic". The food is always 5 stars, why I gave it 4 is the service can be slow, and they try to make it fast food, but try to service it as a more fine restaurant. Most locations you help yourself to the sauces and drinks and condiments. It is a must try if you haven't already tried Nandos!

I know this restaurant from living in South Africa, which is where the sauce peri-peri comes from, well Mozambique to be exact.  So I was very excited to find a Nando's in Calgary while I was visiting my brother.  It did not disappoint.  The sauce is amazing.  I love that their hot sauce, actually means hot, not some watered down version of hot sauce.  But for the more faint of pallets, they have milder sauces.  They grill their chicken, it is very lean and juicy. You can get just chicken or chicken sandwich on Portuguese bread or in a pita. I also recommend the peri fries.  It was nice to know that Nando's, even far from home, still is delicious.

Don't let the 2 star fool you. The chicken, the peri peri fries and those Portuguese rolls are bomb. And within an hour it all came out...but not through the rear exit. My friend also went home with an upset stomach and runny shits.   I feel like my experience was a one time thing. But for some reason the chicken tasted off. Me being an idiot thought it was just the spices so I added more hot sauce not realizing it may be undercooked. But even then the chicken still was super juicy albeit on the small side...and potentially undercooked.   Peri peri fries with the garlic sauce...bless up.  I'll probably have to go again...all the other reviews we are good and in inclined to give it another shot
I've been to several Nandos location and this one remains the best of them all. Great portions, amazing staff, clean environment.  Would recommend to everyone!

Casual setting with great flavours. I do appreciate a place that can cook chicken well, and keep it exciting even though it isn't my meat of choice. I'm not sure that I'm a big fan of the serve yourself atmosphere. One can't dress up the place as it is, and then have food court like service.  Nevertheless I would still keep coming back for the sauces. I highly recommend a sharing platter with chicken skewers, half chicken and wings. Great for two people.

Nando's is a nice option for a sit-down lunch that is more reasonably priced. Here are a few thoughts:  What's not to like:  Upon entering you have to be assigned a table, then place an order at a register. This process can be rather clunky.  Portion sizes tend to be smaller than average.  What's to like:  Their sauces and the chicken are delicious.  The freestyle coke machine.  Prices that are slightly higher than fast food served in a comfortable, nice environment where you could have a legit lunch or dinner meeting.  Plenty of options, though some come with small up charges.

I have been a huge fan of Nando's all my life - growing up in Asia, we've had Nando's since God knows when! When one finally opened up in the downtown area, I was so excited to know that it's so close to where I live! ( see the pattern of why I can never escape food?!)  Anyhow, this is probably the best (almost) fast-food Portuguese roasted chicken in town! The chicken is tender, fresh and flavorful. On top of that, there's so many different sauces you can smother your chicken with. My all-time favorite would be the medium and garlic. They're the perfect match to everything!  Now let's get to the sides. Not the biggest fan of the mashed potato or the coleslaw, but the piri-piri fries are to-die for! I also really like the fountain drinks machine - you don't get to try 100 flavors (the drinks are bottomless!) all the time.   I've yet to try any of their desserts - but certainly would love to at some point. Especially the Portuguese egg tarts that just tempt you at the cashier!

I think that less the 3 stars is a bit harsh.  Nando's chicken is either good or excellent, depending on your preferences. Some of my friends love it and swear by it. I don't, but I still think it's 1000x better than swiss chalet.  If you are craving chicken, then come here and order chicken. If you order only chicken, you will be satisfied. Don't forget to add sauce. It's an essential part of the experience.  However, there isn't much else to offer. The sides are expensive and underwhelming.  Furthermore, the restaurant is sometimes filled with tables of dirty plates. Plus, you are basically serving yourself.  It can also take longer to get your food than it should.  Stick to the chicken.
Very tasty chicken.  Service is a little slow, but the food is nice and fresh. Move expensive than Swiss chalet, but much more tastier.

How can I not like this place .  Reasonable price  Roughly  $15 per person include drink. Unlimited drink and desert  Enough servers and cooks who's friendly.  unique and vintage atmosphere make me feel comfortable .  Their Signature chicken is so tasted and tender. Also I noticed the salad ingredients are all fresh.  Just one thing that it's very busy and crowded . But I still love it :-)

I went there once because I live on that street. I didn't like it at all. The chicken was so, so dry and the skewers are just too small. I immediately realized it's not worth the money. I did like the garlic mashed potatoes but I figured I can probably find that in a box at the supermarket.   What I like is the place itself. The decoration is fun and colourful, the space is large and the staff is friendly.

Restaurants' beauty needs to be more than skin deep.  Nando's attractive Bay Street location is part of the sprawling South African multinational chain, with 1,000 locations worldwide and counting. The decor, furnishings and staff all play a part in the eye candy appeal. But the disconnect between the visual presentation and actual food served is akin to a Hollywood set which looks great but lacks substance.  Their split service concept, rather average food and conversation killing loud background music amounts to a frustrating dining experience.   You're shown to your table to decide on your order, get up to go to one of five cashes to order and pay for it, proceed to the service station to fetch your cutlery, sit back down and wait for your meal to arrive. Since the "server" didn't actually take your order there is no sense of who ordered what. To add insult to injury, dishes arrive at different times as they are prepared as part of a whole location queue rather than for a group of diners at one table. This process is especially annoying when, as in our case, only two of us were dining.  The food while attractively presented leaves plenty to be desired. Let's start with the signature Peri Peri chicken. The sauce, as promised is quite flavourful. The "double" skewers of breast meat, $10, however were miniscule, overcooked and dry. Despite the menu's declaration of "love at first bite" it's far more like a first date gone terribly wrong. There is nothing else included with the chicken as sides are extra. I decide on the Peri Peri vegetables, $2.50, as this pepper based sauce is Nando's feature attraction. The vegetables turn out to be a dj vu experience of the first dish: wonderful sauce but the barely cooked vegetables, primarily made up of humdrum carrots and green peppers, were teeth jarringly raw.   What a disappointment for a global chain that made its name on such a worthy chicken dish, yet displays its inexcusable ineptitude by over cooking it.

Delicious grilled chicken! I love coming here in the winter time, they have that grilled bbq flavour you get from a summer outdoor bbq grill. The sides are also delicious. I love their caesar salad and potato fries. They also have a selection of sauces that are yummy. For such a busy place they have great customer service, we had 4 servers come by to ask us how we're doing and how was the food.

The chicken is so yummy! I took my friend here for a quick lunch. It was her first time, and she enjoyed it. Score!  Every time I come to this location, we are seated quickly and the food comes at a reasonable time.   I always get the lemon and herb because I'm not a fan of spicy foods. Although it's still a little too spicy for me.

This restaurant is THE BEST!!! I come here very often with my friend, and the service is always phenomenal. When you come in you are greeted by someone who brings you to your table, and then give your order at the cash and someone always comes and checks on how the meal is going and then cleans up after you are finished. Today I interacted with four different people and they were all so nice...I couldn't get over it. The food was amazing as always (I had the Halloumi chicken salad) and came to our table very fast.  The service is always outstanding every single time I've been in and every person I've ever interacted with is so nice. I love coming here!

This is the only location I've been to actually. Mainly because of the nice interior decor! The Peri peri chicken is really good with their sauce!! I usually get their corn & rice for the sides. Also, their kisses chocolate dessert is really good too! It was I think around $5? And it's surprisingly not too sweet, good to end the meal! Highly recommend this place if you're in the area!

We came here Asa group for quick dinner.  We order family pack chicken with mango flavour and medium spices.  The food came out quickly and it taste better compare to Swiss chalet.  We also ordered some side dish eg. Fries, rice, and vegetable.  The price was very reasonable averaging $15 all in per person.  The only concern I have is the seating arrangement.  Its more like first come first serve seating.
Nothing wrong with Nando's. But there's nothing to write home about either. It's better than Swiss Chalet.

Unpleasant experience for the past few consecutive times we've been here this year. Corn was not fresh. Chicken wings were dry. Coleslaw had a weird foul taste. The dining area was not clean. Surely, we will not go back. The only good food they had was the garlic bread. If you want to eat at Nando's, go to Downtown instead.

Discovering Nando's more than 10 years ago in Mississauga, it has been a good place to visit if you need a Portugese-ish feel to grilled chicken.  As the years go by, the quality of the food has decreased.  The taste is good and just okay, not stellar as it was in the past.  I don't know if it's because this franchise is mass produced so it's treated like a fast food joint?  I hope not!  I ordered the Double Leg Medium spice with Peri-Peri fries and rice.  It was A-OK.  The chicken tasted fine and everything but it still had a jelly like texture to the meat.  If they left i for a minute or two longer, it would be better as it would be cooked more.  The fries were a bit soggy and the spice was saturated in the middle of the fries and not all around.  Rice was meh.  I hope this place gets better in the future, or else, I may stop going altogether.

Amazing decor and brilliant sitting, perfection when it comes to the flavor and how fresh the chicken is...great value, the best in Canada I think. Great for families, couples and business lunch or dinner. I always been at Mississauga location but I gave it a shot at this amazing Toronto location, great place folks.

This restaurant was recommended to us by a local who works near by.  It was ok - interesting set up where you wait to get seated, then when ready to order go up to the counter like a fast food restaurant and order.  You then collect your own cutlery and any hot sauces you want.  Ordered the 1/4 lemon and herb chicken with spiced rice and garlic mashed potato's.  Nothing spectacular but was ok.  Like another review stated not far off a Swiss Chalet.  Don't think would return.

I've never written a review before but Nando's was so bad that I had to!! Dry chicken, soggy fries, and the coleslaw tasted like I was eating straight mayo. Oh and the wrap was so bad!!! Ugh. Feeling sick. Don't order.
Amazing food great spicy chicken. Even their plainish chicken is deliciously seasoned. A must try as this location is Halal

Nando's has been my go to chicken spot for years!! I absolutely love their BBQ style chicken & obviously the famous sauces!! Way better than Swiss Chalet style chicken in my opinion. The ordering style can be a little confusing for first time visitors so don't be shy to ask questions.  Recently this location has been renovated & I enjoy the bright atmosphere it has now. I only wish they didn't change their coleslaw!! It was very heavy with mayo & not crispy like the previous one. I did tell the manager on duty who was more than happy to switch the coleslaw to garlic mashed potatoes. The garlic mashed potatoes have been improved & they are delicious!!  After writing this review I'm craving some Nando's right now!

I really like the decor and design of Nandos. The restaurant design is very creative and spacious.   I like the concept and the idea of the restaurant. You chose what you want to eat, and then your food is delivered to your table. You also grab what drink you want, and the many sauces they offer. From the menu I ordered the peri peri 1/4 chicken with medium spicy. I got medium because I wasnt sure of how spicy it was. I regret it because it wasn't spicy at all. But next time i will sure to get a higher level of spice. I got the peri peri fries on the side, I really enjoyed the fries, it had a good taste to it, and they give you a generous amount.   Overall I was really impressed by the friendly service, the decor and the food. Nando's is perfect for anyone looking for a casual lunch or dinner.

If I'm looking to have chicken (that's not deep fried) for dinner, this is my go-to downtown. Love the atmosphere and their chicken (dark meat only, white meat can still be a tad dry). Accompanied with garlic mash and macho peas makes the perfect dinner. Their grilled halloumi is also very tasty. And we can't forget about their peri peri sauce, it's the star of the show.   One complaint - they accept SPC but only on the cheapest food item that was ordered... I didn't even get a detailed receipt because they had to input it in a weird way. SPC only stipulated that it can't be used on the share platters and I only ordered double leg w/ 2 sides, appeteaser platter, and 2 beverages. Weird.

Having eaten at Nandos in many different countries, including South Africa where it all started, This location is as good as anywhere. I do wish they had the chicken breast option like they have in England, but I will take the half chicken extra hot any day of the week . And the beans....... Also try the red pepper dip with pita.  Looking forward to the location opening in mahogany down south.

I've always enjoyed Nando's.  Used to be a regular when I lived in Vancouver.  Was happy to see they eventually made their way to Calgary.  We do not eat here as often as hubs would like (he loves it), but when we do we are never disappointed.  Now having said that I will say there is one thing that does disappoint...the fact they do not serve milk!    Moving on we stopped into Nando's last night on our way out for a movie.  Hubs had been wanting to go for awhile.  My daughter and I both ordered chicken pitas, hubs had a half chicken and my boy had the chicken skewer.  Everything was great except my hot peri peri chicken pita was dang hot and the beer / water was not helping to cool down my mouth LOL (milk might have helped!!).  I still proceeded to dip my fries in the hot sauce (call me crazy).  The food was yummy and I love that you are able to buy a bottle of their peri-peri sauce to take home.  They also offer take out which is a great idea for a picnic in the park or an easy meal on a hot summer day.  Service was decent, we were able to order, grab a table...and have our food arrrived shortly after.  We'll be back!

The half chicken was really good and the price was not too expensive. The only downside is the wait time. It took about 10-15 minute for the order and the style of the restaurant reminds you of a fast food take out joint. Overall, I would definitely go back and try the wings or the chicken leg again. Hope this helps!

I've eaten here more than a dozen times ever since it opened. The chicken is just filled with flavour. The peri peri fries are the highlight! The price is fair for what you get. The atmosphere is gorgeous, and especially the festive music playing in the washroom! It's a great place to come whether you're with your whole family or just with friends!

Nando's has to be one of my favourite 'quick' food places when I was living in London, UK.  This is a no-frills kind of place that serves spectacular grilled chicken and family-style sides, all with very unique spices and flavours that come together for an amazing and affordable meal.  Nando's is a Portuguese restaurant with literally hundreds of combinations of ways to eat chicken.    The process to eat is very simple and straightforward.  You are seated as you would expect at a restaurant in Calgary.  This is the end of what you would expect.   At this point you have a table number and that was the end of any opportunity to have a server.  You need to go to the front till and make your order.  Your order starts with how much of a chicken your table wants.  This is served family-style and you can order any parts or entire full chickens.  There are classic sides like Corn on the cob, coleslaw and amazing peri-peri fries.    Once you have ordered, they hand you a cup for your beverage (obviously self-serve) and you choose your owns spices and sauces to add to the mix and you are good to go.  I highly recommend you take the detour and go to Nandos... it's worth every penny!

You can never go wrong with Nando's. Their chicken are flavorful and juicy. So I ordered the Peri Peri 1/4 chicken with coleslaw. Came up as $11. They bring you the chicken. This is like a fast food restaurant with some kind of service. Parking is plentiful. So when you arrive, they ask you how many people and assign a table to you. Then you go order and tell the person taking the order your table number. Once your food is ready, they will bring it over.   Restaurant is clean and has a really nice interesting dcor to it.   Love Nando's

The food is delicious. It is not as greasy as fast food but it is served in about the same time. I visited the establishment on Friday during Easter weekend. It was very busy. I went there with a couple friends and we waited for about ten minutes. We compromised for the common table instead of the booth since we had to rush to movie after. The service is not great. My friend was charged for a drink but never given a glass. Our table was not clean and we asked for it to be cleaned but it never did. We ended up just eating on the dirty table any way.

This is the second evening I have come over for a beer as my kids are at Laserquest (today and Putting Edge yesterday). So I come over to have a beer and it's the first time I have been here. The first impression was the smell...not a pleasant smell but like a greasy kitchen smell. I have heard how their chicken's pretty good and preferred over Swiss Chalet but after the service I had...NO WAY! First let me say, how can I pay tips right in the beginning when I cannot judge the service? A bunch of under aged servers made me wait 20 minutes for a beer (yesterday) and today 10 minutes. Honestly, hire more aged 19 years older servers or let me pour my own beer! Today I sat in a 4 seater and was asked politely to move to a 2 seater as they needed it for 4 people. I moved my own plate and everything off the table to accommodate...them 2 minutes later, 2 people sat down at my old table...wtf?? I then asked the host what happened and he was polite and apologized. They need to have a capable manager make some smart decisions as I will not be coming back to this location due to incompetent service.  I'm not sure if I will EVER go to a Nando's as I'm not impressed. I tried the peri peri sauce and meh...it's all right.

I ate there today with a few friends and the food was amazing. I never ate African or Portuguese before. I was disappointed with the apperance of the seats at the booth. The leather on the seats was peeling off. Otherwise, the customer service was excellent and the supervisor that night was helpful, friendly and fun. I wish they did delivery.

Service: 4/5 Food Quality: 4/5 Kitchen Speed: 5/5 Value: 4/5 Cleanliness: 4/5  Don't think of the place as fast food.  If you do, you'll find the prices unreasonably high.  If you think way back to when Swiss Chalet started, they weren't fast food either.  They were the quintessential go out for chicken place.  I think that's the niche now owned by Nandos.  The food is good and the experience is different from most restaurants.  Worth trying at least once and in our case, worth going back.  Too bad its so far away since we live in the south.

Solid chicken place at a reasonable price. Chicken and hot sauces are the stars, the sides are not.  Went to Nando's and tried a half chicken,and a variety of hot sauces. The chicken skin has a good crispness to it, and the chicken was tasty. The garlic hot sauce was amazing. I was dipping my potato wedges in it too. The sides are less than stellar. The portions for the peas and some of the veggies is pretty small. And the peas didn't have much going on to them. Though I respect that they were firm, so they were probably fresh? Maybe? But they were probably too firm... The potato wedges came in a huge portion. If you are sharing a meal, that is definitely a side worth considering. But they weren't anything special. But they also didn't taste that unhealthy for you and were probably baked. So that is a plus.  If I had kids and a family, I could definitely see taking them here, as it's decent quality food at a reasonable price. But I wasn't blown away to the point where I have to run back. Though if someone gifted me some of their garlic hot sauce I'd be pretty pleased.

My husband and I shared the shared variety platter of chicken and 2 sides.  The chicken was saucy and moist, and the sides were relatively small (especially to come with a shared platter) compared to the amount of chicken.  I didn't taste much of a difference between the different sauces I tried in the chicken.  It was decently priced at about $20-23 per person including taxes and tip.

This is a 2.5. Yelp give us more stars or percentages to play with.  After a long time of not going I visited Nando's again. I remember that I stopped going a couple of years ago because the chicken was low in quality and had bone and marrow inside. This time the chicken seemed of higher quality (1 point) and was also flavourful (another point). The bread was a little different and fine. The chain is known for its peri peri sauces of which they offer herb, medium, hot and very spicy. One can also order it as a wrap or sandwich. The 'hot' is just that and not too much.  The portions are the first disappointment. It is a small sandwich with little in the way of sides or fixings. The chicken itself is rather small in size. It is not a good value. Swiss Chalet has better value.  Nando's clientele also loses it a point. You know the type of men who any self respecting or educated woman avoids: males walking around in track pants and the unwashed look or leaning against their car with the running engine in track pants in the parking lot. That is their clientele. Then there are the families with the unruly and noisy children and the father chewing with his mouth open thinking he is special. This forces you to consider take-out as the only option, which is a good thing to save on tipping.  Another star is also lost because they are slow. It took more than 20 minutes to get the take-out.  Finally, they are open a little later which is a bonus in a city where everything shuts down so early.

The decor is so amazing for a chain restaurant. They've been open for 4 months now. We couldn't resist the garlic bread, so we opted in for starters. Their signature peri peri chicken was very tender but I am not sure if the marinade reaches all the way to the bone as they claim. We quite enjoyed the crispy skin but it got boring in subsequent bites. They offer bottomless cups for soft drinks and you can self serve it from the touchpad. The only downside was the peri peri chicken whole wheat wrap with cilantro yogurt and chilli jam. There was no real taste in the wrap, fortunately we ordered the spicy mayo which helped the cause. The portuguese custard tarts were quite rich and a good way to finish the meal. I don't think it has the kind of draw to have me gravitate towards them in the near future.

Nando's, known for its famous Peri-Peri chicken. I usually order takeout, dining in at the Richmond Hill location, is not ideal for me, too busy during peak times, service is not the best. On the plus side they do serve beer, and the chicken is amazing. My takeout order consisted of one whole chicken, Peri-Peri hot, cut into 8, an order of chicken liver (comes with a bun) and an order of regular chips. My order took approximately 20 to 25 minutes, came with cutlery and I requested two little containers of hot sauce on the side. The person who took my order was friendly and attentive. The food; the chicken was awesome, best in the city, the liver was just okay, what I don't like about their chicken liver, it comes in little pieces not the full whole pieces of chicken liver that I prefer, subsequently the small pieces get overcooked and a little bit dry, the chips were good, nice big pieces. Overall, it was a good meal, the chicken gets top marks, the rest of the meal was average. Value for the money, 4/10, the whole chicken, average size, including tax, was over $21.00. I will always recommend Nando's, there's a reason why they're known for their famous Peri-Peri chicken...

Eaten here multiple times, have to say it's the best flame grilled chicken around. Their side dishes are usually pretty good as well, we usually get a whole chicken, peri peri fries, the garlic bread and a casa salad. Only once in 20 years dining here did I receive a side of cold fries, which they replaced promptly. Usually staff is extremely friendly, on a Monday night on a snowy evening all the staff where in good spirits. Even got a Portuguese tart yum yum!! Best way to finish off your burning mouth from all the delicious peri peri sauce.  Love this place will always keep going back.  The only negative is that sometimes they are so busy you have to wait sooooo long!! But it's always worth it. I recommend eating in rather than taking out. U get all the sauces there to try and your food will be fresh not sitting in a bag on your drive home.

This place is amazing, better then KFC, Swiss Chalet, and Popeyes. I wish the chicken was a little larger but that is my only complaint. Chicken is always juicy and cooked to perfection. It is always spiced perfectly too if you decide to get it a little hotter then plain. The side dishes are also good, especially the garlic bread, and potatoes. Let's not forget to give a shoutout to their amazing nando's sauces for the chicken-my favourite being the garlic sauce. Placing an order for pickup is quick and delicious, and in house dining is also quick with friendly service at the front. I will be back soon, so glad it is down the street from my house :)
This was pretty tasty. We got take out but wished they gave us more piri piri sauce. The chicken was good but I'm not a fan of the turmeric  rice

decor & atmosphere are creative, i like the Nando's hot sauce, grilled pineapple is recommended, as well as the share plate. My boyfriend and i tried the share plate for 2-3, and it's enough for us.it's quite delicious, 1/2 chicken, 5 chicken wings, 2 chicken skewers, and side dishes are grilled corn & peri peri fries, nice deal !

I started going to Nando's way before I joined Yelp so this review slipped my mind until my most recent visit. Then I remembered that I have to give (one of) my favourite restaurant(s) a 5 star rating so everyone can enjoy it!  Where do I begin...I've lived next to Nando's for about 4 years now, and every time I go back I'm blown away by how flavourful and tasty their food is. I've tried just about every item on their menu, but my ABSOLUTE favourites are:  1) chicken (duh) - get the half or quarter if you're feeling like chicken, the double skewers may be tantalizing but it's really not worth your money. 2) chicken sandwich - for only $8.55 by itself or $13.05 with TWO sides, you can't beat the price on this sandwich. The roll is one of the best breads I've ever had on a sandwich, and it really fills you up for cheap. 3) whole wheat chicken wrap - I think I love this for the sweet chilli jam and cilantro yogurt, but whatever they're putting in there it's working for me. Same price as the chicken sandwich, but I find it to be a lot more flavourful.  4) peri-peri fries - get this with the perinaise (it'll cost you an extra $1, but trust me, it's worth it).  The thing about Nando's is that you order and pay up at the front counter, then they bring the food to you. You're responsible for getting your own cutlery, sauces, and drinks. This causes me some turmoil when it comes to tipping (which you are expected to do at the time of ordering), because I am a firm believer that tips are earned, not expected. If you do a good job of taking my order, bringing me my food, refilling my water and whatnot, you deserve the 15% tip. But if all you're doing is walking my plate from the kitchen to my table, then I'm not sure if they should be demanding a 15% tip up front (their tip options on their card machines are 15%, 18%, and 20%). Not the biggest deal because I really do love their food, but it bothers me a little every time I'm there.  TL;DR Go to Nando's and get some chicken. You won't be disappointed. The wait times may be deterring sometimes, but just wait it out - the line moves fast and you'll soon be enjoying some juicy, mouthwatering chicken.

Beautiful location in downtown Toronto. I've had nandos in zim, SA and Maryland. Maryland location wasn't any good. This locations food is comparable to SA and zim. Nice succulent chicken and seasoned well. I love nandos hot sauce. I am glad we decided to give this location a try. I recommend the spicy rice and veggies as well.

The chicken was quite dry even after waiting 30 minutes for takeout as they were extremely busy and said they made it fresh. Please. We had to dip it in something just to make it edible. The fries came out of the kitchen lukewarm as well. They had obviously been under the heatlamp for quite some time.  The only saving grace is the price but I would rather just make it myself without the old dry texture and day old fries.

A reasonably useful lunch place. Drive in, get some chicken with salad, pour some sauce over the remnants of that nonflying bird, eat the result, go back to work.  Food quality is decent, though variety is not there - at all. You can choose from basically the same plate, with different levels of "spicy", defined by the sauce.  Service is nice, ambient is far from cozy (them hard-surfaced benches), but overall the place is clean and quite visitable.

Service is good, taste is impeccable! We love Nando's and come to this SAME location everytime we're in town...   We even get the large sauce to take back home ($50) but its sooo tasty!  The people that work there are sweet, helpful and reallllly accomodating. It's fast food but with a great sit-down dining experience. Ambiance is nice and although I'm not familiar with Portuguese culture, I am assuming their cuisine is awesome because of my experience here....  It's not too salty, but with a kick of garlic and spice on their chicken. The prices are cheap consider 5 people were ABSOLUTELY full from a $50-60 pricetag (and this included three hungry males).   We ordered whole chicken (medium spice) and half chicken (extra spicy) it was a family pack and came with three sides which were good. Their slaw is nice, corn on the cob was a nice touch as well, and baked potato which is a baked potato.   Will continue to come back here and hope others enjoy it!   If you're in the mood to just "try it out" they have a $6 chicken sandwich in a pita that was VERY tasty.

I told two of my co-workers that I go on Yelp! to review places so they checked out my reviews.   Jonathan asked if I ever tried Nandos, and I told him I haven't.  "WHAT??" as his mouth drops and eyeballs pop out of the sockets, he was shocked.  He raved and raved about Nandos so we chose a day to go out so I can give this Nandos a try.    Nandos is located on 32nd avenue in the NE, not too far away from work.  We decided to go on a Wednesday right at noon.  Thankfully, it wasn't overly busy as expected!  I asked for suggestions and Jonathan suggested the whole chicken with a hot peri peri heat because I can pack up the leftovers so that's what I went with along with the peri peri fries which totaled to about ~$23.  How it works is you pretty much, walk up to the counter, pick your chicken, pay, and then take a seat...they'll bring your order right to your table!!  The nice thing is you pay before you eat so you don't have to wait around for a bill when you're done.  The table has some sauces on the table for the chicken (hot, extra hot or garlic) as well as peri peri spices.  When our orders came, I was pretty excited!  Whole chicken cut up on one plate, a separate side plate for peri peri fries and an empty plate to fill your plate with the chicken and fries!!  My first bite was great!! They marinate all their chicken for 24 hours in their secret sauce until the flavor goes right through to the bone so it's really tender and juicy.  I like crisp so it was nice that the skin had a slight crisp to it!  I thought the chicken was so tasty it didn't need any sauces!  I'm usually not a big fan of hot & spicy foods but for picking hot, it was good! Nothing that burnt my tougue off but enough for me to handle!  As for the fries...they were regular fries with a little bit of spices on top...nothing as special as the chicken!  All in all, my meal was expensive but I have dinner for later on or lunch for the next day!  It all evens out!  I'm happy I gave Nandos a try because it's definitely another option for lunches and its some seriously healthy chicken!! ;)  Ps. Only location in Calgary!!!

A very small restaurant but tasty food. The sauces and marinades are delicious! The chicken is a little dry. The Peri peri fries are so good! A little bit on the expensive side but you're getting fresh, hearty food.

I came here with a large group and wasn't sure what to expect for a chicken wings place. I was pleasantly surprised. There was plenty of seating, great environment and layout. The staff were also very friendly and professional. Despite having a large group we got our orders reasonably quickly. I ordered the double leg combo with veggies and Garlic smashed potatoes as sides. It was much better than I expected. The sauce was delicious and the chicken was not too dry or greasy.  The place also has unlimited fountain drinks which you can grab from one of those multiflavour machines (like the ones in cineplex). I would also recommend the tart as a desert. It was really good. Overall I would most definitely come back.

Just had Reno looks great inside  Best nandos in gta in terms of food and service  We usually get the chicken w fries garlic bread and chilli  Great spot for kids w multiple high chairs  Chicken is always juicy and remember to grab your own sauce.

I make it a point to try to come here at least once every few weeks. I'm a huge fried chicken but Nando's has made me fall equally in love with grilled chicken because it tastes so great here. The chicken sandwich is highly underrated, I don't see many people get the sandwich but it tastes great (especially with their sauces) and the chicken is juicy and tender. My other favourites are the 1/4 chicken and 1/2 chicken (extra hot) and I can always count on those to hit the spot. They also have a great variety of sides, my favourites being the corn and peri-peri fries.  Can never go wrong with a cheeky Nando's.

Wow!! This is some of the best takeout I've had in a lonnnnnnnnnnnmg time...sorry just trying to get my point across. Seriously though I walked in here and made a takeout order and it was amazing. I never grabbed the name of the fellow who took my order but he was super nice and informative with the menu as I have never ordered from here. All the other staff I can across was also very friendly and I wasn't even there for 10 minutes! I ordered some hot chicken sliders, a portobello and  halloumi cheese slider and a Nando's sized Cesar with the extra hot chicken. Let's start with the sliders. The chicken was most and had the right amount of spice. The buns were tasty.. mmmm buns .. but the chicken really stole the show here. It was moist and sooo full of flavor. If you like hot stuff I would definitely bump it up to extra sauce. The portobello and halloumi cheese slider was different but also very good. It would be an excellent vegetarian option but also good for anyone. Now the Cesar salad was good. The sauce was creamy but average overall. The croutons were crisp and tasted good also. I was so impressed with the quality of the lettuce though. So many times I order a salad from OTHER resteraunts and get browned pieces of lettuce or pieces with spoilage. Not this salad!! Every piece of lettuce was crisp and green! The Parmesan cheese was big and flakey that comes in the salad. I ordered the extra hot chicken with my Cesar salad and was truly delicious. The peri-peri chicken is deliciously flame broiled on the grill. I got take out but there is a nice dining room. They have small tables for 2-4 people all the way up to large tables and booths for big groups of people. I would definitely recommend this place. I'll be returning here again this week! So good!!

I never realized that chicken served as a main dish on an empty big plate, with either a spit of  salad or fries, can be so small for $12.99.   This place is a joke, and even stylized pseudo-Portuguese style won't help it: the portions are tiny and highly overpriced, the ridiculous serve-yourself process is disruptive and the hunger after "eating" here speaks for itself.      Avoid

I'm a big fan of the chicken here. It's moist, tasty and perfectly seasoned! I don't know what the secret is, but the chicken is consistently juicy and perfectly cooked! My only quarrel is the quality to price factor. Don't get me wrong, the chicken is phenomenal but it might be the most expensive grilled chicken that I've ever eaten. Beggars can't be choosers, and their peri-peri sauce is out of this world.

We came on a Friday night around 7.  This is a place where you order at the front counter take a seat and you get served your meal. It's a bit more pricy but seemed like a good alternative to other "fast food" options.  It became very busy after we ordered but it wasn't too bad when we first arrived however we waited 40 minutes for our meal! There seemed to be very little method to the madness. People who came in after us but ordered their food to go received their food first. There was very few staff that would acknowledge your inquires I assume because everyone was asking where their food was.   The food was ok, small portion sizes.  The chicken was flavourful but definitely not worth the price or the  wait!

How have I not reviewed Nando's yet? Ever since we discovered the location on Bay St last year, we've almost always had it for Sunday dinner. Best tasting chicken (and garlic bread... and pasteis de nata) in the city. Literally finger lickin good. 5/5 no question.
Ordered the platter for two and grilled liver. Lots of food. Really, really dry chicken.  Blah wings. Meh liver. Limp fries. Unremarkable veggies. Decent hot sauce.Nice Decor. Friendly service.

I was here recently with a co-worker. I have to admit that I came with high expectations as I had very good Nandos chicken when I used to live in the UK.  However, the chicken here was quite dry and quite flavourless. The chicken piece was not tender at all. The rice was good but quite spicy so I suppose for those who like it spicy this is a good choice.  The potato salad was good but not so good that it left an impression.  Overall, service was quite fast but you order at the cash and they bring it to you so it's more of a fast food style than a restaurant style kind of service.   Would I go back? Probably not...

The fact that this place lacks sides like mac n cheese, corn bread, sweet potato fries, it's peri peri garlic sauce and hot sauces makes up grandly for it..So where do I start, I love chicken, I love spice, and this place offers both of these items. I came here with friends ordered 1/4 chicken with peri peri fries for $13.99 it was a steal! A great alternative to Swiss Chalet and the Chalet sauce...although I bet salt count is exactly the same in both places...

I'd say I expected more chicken when I order a whole chicken but it's good for the price.   They have a range of condiments at the back and I really like the taste of their hot sauce!! definitely would go again its my go-to place for fast protein fix   The side is pretty small tbh and its already the "large" size. but do go if you like tasty spicy tender chicken

I've had nandos in brampton n the downtown place is the same food wise: delicious! Its big but gets full fast (not surprising coz the food is tasty). We were a big group, we sat in a round table, ate yummy food, and played cards against humanity haha. You cant go wrong if you're looking for a chicken place downtown.  I gave only 4 stars because they need to be better organized when they are full. We waited for 15 mins before someone actually finding out our party size n giving us a waiting cue.

I have since been back and tried their Quinoa with Roasted Sweet Potato and Avocado salad for $8.99 (add $4.50 for chicken) and really enjoyed it. The portion was great, and the ingredients were fresh. I would not bother adding the chicken though because the amount of chicken they give you is not worth the $4.50 (tiny portion). I don't like dining in during the rush hours (noon and 6pm) because it gets very loud and it is difficult to have a conversation.

I enjoyed it here. It's a sociable atmosphere and you're encouraged to get up and move around a bit. We had the piri piri full chicken which was cooked perfectly, some mashed potatoes which were tasty and some peas which were just okay. You've got to go in knowing it's a different kind of restaurant experience. If you just go with it, you'll have a great time.

Ive only came to Nando's a handful of times, but i would always choose it over swiss chalet. I love the peri peri flavour that comes out the chicken. Also, don't forget to try the peri-peri fries! At the side they have mild, medium, hot, and garlic peri-peri sauce to add one. Must try! If you like spicy food go right for the hot. PRICE: $$ The price is about what you would pay at swiss chalet, but i feel like the chicken is a bit smaller. Ive attached a photo of the menu for you to look at. CUSTOMER SERVICE: Its not like your traditional restaurant where they take your order at your seat. If you'd like take out, you order at the front, and if you want to dine-in the server will seat you and give you a table number. You then can look at the menu at your table and go up to the front to place your order and pay.  *Don't forget your table number*.  The servers are hard to get sometimes and i had to go up to the front to ask for a few things.  I give the customer service a 3.5/5

Nando's just showed up on Doordash, so naturally being the quizzical person I am, we just had to order! It's been years since I've had it, but I definitely remember the delicious sauce on the table, and the familiar taste of home-grilled wings.   We grabbed up a couple double leg dinners with peri peri fries, spiced rice, and a side of grilled wings (Don't judge me ok), and it was bommmb! I cheated and reheated the fries in the toaster oven, and doctored up the chicken with a slathering of peri peri sauce - but still, it was really good! The meat was super tender, and not over cooked.   That peri peri sauce though, damn! I could bathe in it....  The price is average, but for the impact value this place has, it gets 4 stars.

As you enter, you see a really nice decor. You sit in to just look at the menu and have to order upfront. The service is really nice and quick. The chicken was really juicy and the mild/hot chicken had the best taste and we used the garlic peri peri sauce which was amazIng with fries. The peri peri rice had a really nice taste aswell and if chicken is too spicy for you the rice was amazing to dull it down. That was a big plus for my gf since she doesn't like spicy food but I love it. Overall the half which was very juicy, not greasy and tasted even better with peri peri garlic flavor which gave it a perfect kick.

When I was studying abroad as a poor exchange student in the UK, Nando's was the go-to place for post-drinking chicken and chips. When Nando's opened at its Bay location, I was ecstatic to relive the taste of drunken shame and peri-peri sauce.   We arrived on a rainy Friday evening and had no issues being seated. The menu is a little different at this location, but the Variety Share Platter we ordered was everything I love at Nando's: wings, skewers, and a half chicken. I usually am a huge fan of the wings, but out of the 5 we received, 3 were a tad undercooked. Other than the disappointment of the undercooked wings, the chicken was juicy and the sauces were just as tangy and delicious as I remembered.  The drink dispenser is one of the really elaborate fun ones that has over half a million flavours or something. I always mistrusted these dispensers, because I felt like the unpopular flavours are never changed and just sit there in their artificial disgustingness. My mistrust still did not discourage me from trying the gross lime and raspberry flavours, which tasted just as I expected - a mix between burnt plastic and cough syrup.  For dessert we ordered the carrot cake because I am a huge suck for it. My ideal carrot cake is plump with raisins and oh so moist. This one was a little crumbly and covered in too much icing, but it was still enjoyable.  Overall, it was a reasonably pleasant dinner with too-dim lighting, and I will have absolutely no qualms about coming back for a budget-friendly meal. However, it definitely did taste better when I was young and naive eating Nando's out of a take-away container after five pints too many.

Their chicken tastes good but the portions are small. I mean, that "half a chicken" is really half of a very small chicken. I've had a quarter chicken at home that filled me more than their half a chicken.

Ordered delivery from Nando's and was pretty disappointed.   First off, the potato wedges were mixed with fries and some weird chips. It seemed as though they were just closing up shop and wanted to get rid of scraps.   Second, the mashed potatoes were raw.  Third, rice was rock hard.   Fourth, chicken was bland.   Fifth, the portions were trash, overpriced garbage.   Paid $28, for 2 chicken meals and it was a big disappointment.   My experience in store was definitely different from delivery.
Their chicken is really juicy, and the place is cute and colorful. Remember add some sauce to ur meal. Nice try if u curious about Portuguese + South African food :)

Had the worst experience ordering online from this location. We ordered two foods to be delivered to us through the Nando's official website. The person who delivered the food walked for 15 minutes in -15'C to deliver the food in a paper bag. We received the food cold and uneatable. We ended up going to some other restaurant to eat. I cannot believe I spend to much money and time on this. Will never eat here again.

I'm not sure about Nando's.  The service staff were great and I didn't mind ordering at the counter.  The decor was cool.  But it was a little to "shopping mall" busy for me and the chicken was definitely a bit too salty.  I'll probably give it another shot but I am not sure the Chipotle of Peri Peri chicken will do it for me.

If the window's any indication, Nando's is the place to be among the younger civil servant set.   Every day around lunchtime, this place is packed with sharp-dressed 20-30 year olds, looking for different poultry than their Chalet-loving parents. Quarter chicken with dries and sauce? That's as old school as the finger-bowls they used to offer.   Nando's is hip. It's now. it's confusing.   We wait in line to be seated among the pretty young things of Bay Street, only to jump up in order to place our order at the cash.   We choose from a dizzying array of chicken and sides, and customize our birds with a choice of peri-peri sauce.   My colleague opts for grilled chicken breast with salad. I choose a chicken sandwich, extra-hot, with a ice of allegedly special potato wedges.   Food arrives within a few minutes (a good thing, since we're on the clock to get back to our respective offices).   The chicken is...well, chicken. Cooked just a bit past juicy, it's nonetheless livened by the Peri-Peri sauce (which itself registers as more sweet than heat).   My sandwich arrives on hefty Portuguese bread, which may actually be the best thing about it (although fresh lettuce and ripe tomato are welcome surprises for late Fall).   The aforementioned wedges are the usual spice-dredged deep-fried slabs 'o' spud. My colleague salutes my willpower, but frankly I'd rather save room for the bread.   Nando's may be the new school in Toronto's chicken scene, but for fries and sauce that's truly boss, I'd rather kick it old school at the Chalet Swiss.

They practically asked for my first-born in exchange for wifi.  Made me wait 10 minutes to order despite a full staff and only two customers.  Then the pop machine wouldn't work.  Then the other pop machine malfunctioned, spraying me with fanta syrup that stuck to my arms and cheeks like a drunken henna tattoo.  Then I received dirty cutlery.  Then the food took 25 minutes.  Then, while bringing my order, the server dropped about a third of my fries on the floor but decided not to replace them.  Then the chicken arrived cold with spongy, gelatinous skin, obviously not cooked despite me asking for it to be well done.  With tax and a tip, 27 dollars.  Ouch.

A little pricey but the chicken and hot sauce are perfect. There's a drinks machine with more than enough variety. Anyhow chicken and hot sauce is probably what I'll be heading back for. Also hot mayo.

In all honesty, I really was looking for better.   Maybe my mistake was going here on the coldest night of the year.  The doors really aren't well insulated, as gusts of -20 winds easily got into the building freezing any poor customer seated nearby.  Imagine how much worse that is when the doors are open as people go in and out.  I was seriously unimpressed with the chicken.  It wasn't really all that flavorful, so I might have gotten them on a bad day?  I read some of the other reviews, but what I experienced was just not even ok.  The only standout really was the chicken livers appy, which we ended up ordering a 2nd order.  But as for the rest, it just wasn't a particularly good portuguese style chicken.    To the owners of Nando's in Calgary, I would honestly go to Montreal and try out how it's really done at Coco Rico on St-Laurent St (and while you're at it, get a smoked meat at Schwartz's which is just next door).  I know you're hamstrung by corporate recipes, but honestly, I think you'll be way seriously more impressed by Coco Rico and tweak what you can to match the raw flavour, taste and simple joy that they bring to their customers.

3.5 I came here because British youtubers rave about Nando's all the time. I was disappointed to find the chicken and peri peri wedges just okay. The portions are not big so definitely would recommend getting the 1/4 chicken with TWO sides or just get the 1/2 chicken. The decor was nice though and the bathrooms were very clean.

If you don't know what to eat today, eat at Nando's!!!  Every Friday night my friends and I get together after work for a few drinks, and we ALWAYS end up at this Nando's. It's become a tradition. It's actually so weird how excited we get for Nando's on a Friday night.  I have been to Nando's a few times before at other locations and it's not as fancy as this one! This place is huge with high ceilings and communal tables perfect for large groups, or booths to get comfy and to induce your food coma even faster.  I have no complaints on their food. Their chicken is perfect every time, and their sides are whatever but their sauces make everything taste 10x better.

First and last visit.   Scrawny stringy chicken served at room temperature with a casa salad that was so old it couldn't even remember it's youth.  Partner had a chicken pita. Let's just say that when it comes with a Kraft single boldly overflowing from the pita you just know it's not going to be good.  I was confused by their demand to pay before being served but it became clear during dinner. Also, why am I tipping? We even had to set our own table!  On the plus side the decor is lively and colourful.

Nando's is a Portuguese style flame-grilled chicken place.  The chicken is quite good and flavorful.  Expect a long line if you aren't there right at noon (for lunch).  We waited a good 20 minutes before we ordered (they don't take orders over the phone).  Another 10minutes later we were eating around 12:40pm.  I'd try to go back here again at dinner if I go back at all.  The hostess could not be found and when she did appear she was clueless.  We asked for a table and she said there were no tables available but she took our name down... After a few minutes we found a few empty tables and just sat down ourselves.  She never did look for us.  Food is OK, service needs improvement.

I am still confused how this place is a mix of South African and Portuguese food. But after reading that Toronto has a big Portuguese community we decided to try this place out. I thought the decor inside was really cool and unique, but I wasn't as excited by the limited wait service they offer. How am I supposed to pay and tip before I had any service? Not a smart idea. As for the food, we did the family special. The chicken was pretty good, and I liked the sauces that they used, but you can't amaze me too much with chicken. The garlic bread was also very good, I should've gotten more! We got the sangria jug too, but it didn't taste that great.

Dat chicken!!! Moist, juicy and flamed-grilled with just the right amount of heat and flavour. The peri peri rub is smokey, sweet, zesty and possesses the perfect kick.   I usually order my food to go and have never bothered sitting down to eat here. However this particular location looks very chic with its cool modern decor. It is also very family-friendly.  You can order the chicken as whole (cut up), skewers, wings etc. in various degrees of spiciness. The sides include peri peri fries, which I find a tad too salty. Macho peas, peri peri veggies, corn, coleslaw and spiced rice are also on the menu.  The peri peri sauces, which are also sold at the counter, come in extra-hot, hot, or garlic.

I'm not sure I buy into the hype that is Nandos - both the chicken and the sauce. For the amount you pay, you don't get a lot of chicken. The leg and thigh is tiny and you always end up craving more. The taste of the chicken is alright, I feel like you can get a better tasting rotisserie chicken from Costco at the same price. If the price INCLUDED a side, I think it would be more worth it. But as it currently stands, I won't be returning to Nando's unless I absolutely have no other food options.  Everyone raves about the sauce but I didn't find it to be particularly amazing. It definitely had a kick, but there was nothing special and I haven't craved it since.

3.5 star  I am not really sure.... that Classic Shared Platter ($25) is for 2-3 people??   I know it is a WHOLE flame-grilled chicken... maybe it is a baby chicken.. I don't think it is ready to be eaten yet..  The chicken though is good... We even able to get half of it in mild and half in extra spicy... At least no one would able to eat my XX spicy half.  The peri vegetable is grilled then tossed in olive oil ... almost the highlight of the meal.  Family owned with the wife at the cash and the daughter delivering the meals... nice enough people... homey feel...  I love Peri Peri Sauce...and it is great that extra of those are on the table for me to drown my chicken in the wholesome spiciness!!

Like, this place was fine.  I was initially intrigued when I read that this chain is found in a lot of different countries.  However....it's really nothing earth shattering.  After debating between just pieces of chicken or the chicken pita, the cashier basically told me to get the pita.  So I did.  One of the cool things is that you can pick the type of sauce you want on the chicken and I picked the hot sauce.    Again, it was fine.  The fries weren't that amazingly seasoned as the other reviews suggest.  The sauces that they give you weren't anything to rave about.  Perhaps ordering just chicken would have been a better idea.  Or, maybe eating AT the restaurant would have enhanced my experience.  Whatever the case, I don't need to come back here if I ever find one again.

Delicious delicious chicken. I cant get enough of their piri piri sauce. Although pretty expensive as compared to the grocery store rotisserie chicken that you can buy for half the price it is a nice treat every now and then if you are getting tired of the same old chicken. The sides are meh. The chicken is the ckear star. I wouldn't go too often but on days I am too tired to cook we will be walking over to Nando's.

I was pretty excited when Nando's first opened thinking there'd be a great new place near Queen's Park to eat lunch at.   Unfortunately the order at the cashier and the line-ups make this place a terrible choice for lunch. And in terms of a business lunch, forget about it.   Food is decent, but the entire setup keeps me away from this place. Too bad.

My favorite Nando's in all of Toronto! Great location, a lot of seating area, definitely can accommodate a huge group of friends. I always getting the 1/2 chicken (hot) with spicy rice and a drink. The chicken is amazing and the rice is just as great! A variety of sauces are always at your disposal. Huge selection of drinks as well, I love Coca Cola Vanilla, definitely try Peach Sprite! Everytime I go and I plan my next trip to Nando's. Make sure to log into the free WIFI, you'll get BOGO deals texted to you time to time.

If you're going to choose a Nandos in Toronto this should be your pick. The decor is top notch as they renovated a few years ago. There's beaded curtains around some of their schmoozy tables which you may need to call ahead for and reserve. They also have long tables for more people. Something special is their drink station. It's unlimited refills and definitely worth it because you can make a zillion combinations of the pop.  I like the concept of ordering food and having it brought to you. It's faster and it saves time especially if you want a decent meal but don't want to deal with the whole shebang. Personally I prefer the chicken to their wraps. I find the wraps too dry and bland. The chicken can be toned down if you get mild and you can build up flavours with their lemon and herb sauce or other sauces. Be aware of their spice levels as their spicey is quite hot. My favorite sides are the peri peri fries which are seasoned to perfection. Their mashed potatoes are also a winner.

This Nando's has a beautiful decor. The beaded chandeliers added a creative ambience to the space.  Unfortunately, the Churrasqueiras was not up to par with the locations in Vancouver. The chicken was not as succulent nor was it as flavorful as I previously remembered. Fortunately, the sauce complimented the dish and escalated the overall flavors.  Tip: Pitas are 1/3 smaller than typical pitas. The prices between the wraps, sandwiches and the pitas are at par ($6.50 - 6.99), however, it seems the wraps are a better choice for value.   P.S. Bottomless frozen yogurt for $3.95 :)
Loved chicken a lot, fried rice is not so much, lived garlic bread, found service a little confusing, if you have never been there might not know what to do, since servers kind of disregard.

Got takeout, food portions leave slot to be desired at $10 for an entree with one small side. I would recommend increasing the side size then making you pay $2 more for more potatoes. Nice looking location but if your looking for value, I think it's better spent elsewhere.

My coworkers and I have been frequent visitors to this location and I'm sad to say that the quality dropped dramatically with the new crew. They got half of our order wrong and made us wait over half an hour for some of the dishes. The quality of the chicken was significantly worse than before, it didn't even look the same! The fries were already semicold when brought out. Don't think we'll be coming back again.

Catering menu for office function review:  I've eaten at this location a few times and every time I've been there, both the service and food were good.  Where they really wowed me, however, was the level of service and professionalism they provided me with when I ordered from their catering menu and had food delivered to my office for 40 staff members.   I ordered the large peri platter with salad, potato wedges and veggie sandwiches on the side.  Placing the order was super simple. The two managers I spoke to were very helpful. There was a discrepancy in the pricing of two menus which they accommodated me for due to the confusion.  The food arrived on time and tasted great. They don't actually have a delivery service - they put the food in a cab and you pay for the cab upon arrival but that was fine by me - it worked fine.  Where they went above and beyond was that I was tied up on a phone call and didn't notice the time, they had actually called me to tell me that my order had arrived.  If I missed that call the cab would have left.  Koodos to Nando's! I would definitely order from them again.

Nice airy space got takeout Better than Swiss chalet Expensive but well worth it Had lemon chicken breast with wedges and coleslaw Love the paper bag and cardboard containers  Unlike the ugly plastic at Swiss chalet

My first experience in a Nando's! I've heard plenty of things about this chain, but never got a chance to try the food yet. I was walking by today, and thought, why not! Going to live in this area, might as well enjoy the food!   I gotta say, I really enjoy the atmosphere here. It's just the right amount of professional and cooky put together. Kind of reminds me of my grandma's house back in Europe.  I got a Peri Peri chicken sandwich, which comes served on a ciabatta bun. By the end of my meal, I looked like a crackhead, because of all the flour being left on my chin.  Having taken a lemon & herb spice level, I was surprised to find the sandwich medium spicy. I really like spicy food, I just feel like they should warn people who can't handle too much spice.  All in all, an hour later, I have already forgotten the meal..the food was definitely just A-OK, which is a testament to their current very much 3-star rating on Yelp.  Will come back again if I don't have other options.

A step up from Swiss Chalet for sure. However I wasn't impressed with the portions.   4 of us ordered the whole chicken meal (thinking it was going to be an actual whole chicken) only to find out that it's pre-cut and cooked separately. The flavour was delicious, but even the sides were kinda wimpy. Pricey as well. Overall it was just ok. Will have to go back and get my own personal meal.

Quarter chicken dinner with medium heat, mashed potatoes, coleslaw.for him and side caesar for me. Tip in, it's $55. You pay first, which is weird but one person knew my bf and treated us with utmost respect! Since it was our first time, he delighted us with quips and recommendations. The chicken is OMG; juicy, tender and full of delicious flavour, especially lovely on a cold day. Only reason why it's not five stars is the portion size; on the small size but decadent. However, that was a clean and tasty dinner I'd definetely have again! Also, we were given Nando's Kisses on the house and it was so nice and sweet like the person who served us. Verg cobtent and.highly suvvest coming.here before a night of action plus debauchery.

When I originally reviewed this place, I gave it 3 stars. It was an average of 4 stars for the lemon and herb flavoured chicken and 2 stars for the nonsense of having to get my own utensils.  I stand by that initial rating but now they've added a new flavour option for the chicken - mango and lime - and it's really good so I'm tempted to increase my rating...  ...but no, I get annoyed having to go up and get my own utensils and napkins and sauce. Like seriously??

Interior decoration is on point, food is not so much.  Once you order at the front, you pick up your own utensils and sauces, and the servers will bring your food to your table once it's ready.  Peri-peri Chicken Thigh (lime seasoning) with 1 side (3/5)- It tasted good, but their chicken size was small. I especially liked the garlic hot sauce Bottomless frozen yogurt (3.5/5)- It was pretty cool that they had a froyo machine that you can get however much plain vanilla froyo you wanted. It was pretty standard and wasn't too friendly for my lactose-sensitive stomach though.  I had a few friends who ordered their Chicken Skewers...you'll be disappointed at how little meat you get for almost $20.

The chicken is definitely juicy and flavourful. It's definitely a step up from your typical Swiss Chalet rotisserie chicken. There were a variety of sides to choose from, but the rice dish had a kind of weird taste to it. Definitely wouldn't recommend the rice for a side.
Eat Nando at London servers years before. The taste does not change too much, but the size became smaller here.

Well all I gotta say about Nando's is Nan-dont!  Take my word on this one folks.  I don't understand what the fuss is all about!  Its no better than Christy's Chicken just up the street, I actually prefer Christy's.  At least its not a fucking gong show there like it is here!  We went in on a Saturday with 2 other couples and 4 kids and were told  that a.) they don't take reservations so its first come, first served and b.) there is only 1 family table (there was another long one in the middle of the restaurant but it was bar height seating.   We head out anyway only to find that the wait is about 30-45min, fine, I drove out from the NW, I had no problem waiting. We put our name down and headed out to our cars because there is no bloody waiting area.  Its sheer chaos!  There were about 20 people in the doorway, people coming to take pick up orders, people lined up into the dining area placing orders, 3-4 "waitresses" delivering food to people and people everywhere! By the time we sat down it was well over an hour.  We had one family make a comment about how we got in before they did and gave us nasty looks all night.  The assholes they are, didn't notice that we all were waiting in our cars so our kids wouldn't be a bother to other patrons!!  You would think a place this busy would have those stupid flashing coasters and be delicious...nope and nope!  I agree completely with James B on this one, have a bloody sit down service with waitresses instead of this cafeteria get up.  We had other families walking in complaining about the wait, practically sitting down as people were putting their jackets on, there was one family that had their spawn running amuck in the restaurant filling up frozen yogurt  and pop the entire time we were there and one of the kids got up on the table to dance while the parents were busy molesting each other.  Classy.    And the piece de resistance was these imbeciles brought in McDonalds meals for their kids!  WHO THE FUCK DOES THAT?!  AND WHAT KIND OF RESTAURANT ALLOWS THIS?! What irked me more than the table dancing kids and busy-hands parents was there was no one there telling them that this was unacceptable behaviour!!!  There was not authoritative figure in the entire place.   The food was below average in my opinion; the Spicy or Hot chicken tasted like Sriracha chicken and the garlic herb tasted like that powder mix you could buy anywhere, it was mainstream grilled chicken with some mediocre sauces that you pick up yourself from a back bar. (note: the bottles are constantly man-handled by other patrons and not wiped down, simply moved from the dining tables back to the community table.)  The "family" sized sides are barely enough for two people, the rice was old and dry.  The wedges were basically thick cut fries, and the coleslaw and garlic bread were the only redeeming sides.    Kids portions were comical, my 8 year old was still hungry after the tiny drum and thigh meal was served to him with about 12 fries.  They don't even get a beverage with the meal, you have to buy it separately ($8.50meal plus $2.50drink is a buck cheaper than an adult meal!!)  and they give them an "all you can eat" frozen yogurt cup...btw all the yogurt was done by 7:30 and most of the pop was flat or out of syrup.    No apologies for anything, what a waste of time and money.  I would have rather gone to Chianti's or Christies just up the street for a fraction of the price and wait time.    My gut didn't feel right all night afterwards and the next morning I still didn't feel better, total and utter FAIL!  How one can mess up grilled chicken is beyond me...if you wanna see this debacle for yourself, then come here on a Saturday for dinner, seeing is believing.  Unacceptable, will never, ever come back. Ever.  What a joke.
Their pita tastes pretty good. But the price is a bit high for a small pita (around $8)

A solid 2!!!  Yes a 2!!!  Why all the excitement for a 2?  After trying to go here a few times and failing to get a seat, we finally made it!  Yay!  Tick this off the must eat bucket list!!!  Meh-maybe... Wow.  One side of the restaurant looks like a kiddie playroom.  Limited seating on both sides of the place - now I see why they have such long line ups sometimes.  Also, the washroom doors were wide open and people were dining next to them - Yuck!  We sat on the other side...of course. First time being there, had the familia dinner.  Basically a whole chicken with two skewers of more chicken, two sides, two breads.  The bread is OK.  Garlic bread is the same bread with some garlic butter on it.  We had the corn - tasty but burnt, and the peri-peri fries.  The fries were hard and tasteless. The chicken was good but one of portions was raw!  We got another piece and this time it was burnt!  OMG-QQF! Oh well, suffice it to say.  Been there, done that.  Don't think it will be on my list of "Gotta Go Again!!!!" Cheers!

My first time trying Nando's and I enjoyed my meal. The grilled chicken was flavorful and I love the different sauces they had. Garlic Al'ail and Medium sauces ftw. Garlic mash potatoes were also great. Servings are huge. Servers were quick and friendly. Wish they'd franchise in the US.
My BF love's this place (I think it's a nostalgia thing), but I think it's meh. There are definitely better, locally-owned, churrascarias in the area!

Location:  Located in a plaza off of Yonge Street. Fee parking, very bus accessible because its close to a viva stop! .  Decor:  It is bright with lots of window. A very small crowded dine in place. The order part is a small area when you watch in. I'm a big line up orderly person and ordering here sometimes gives me a wee bit anxiety. Line ups are sometimes not followed.  Getting food:  When you order and stay in, you go and sit and they bring you your food. OK. Once again anxiety, food doesn't necessarily come to people in the order that you ordered.  The Food:  It is great. The chicken in the peri peri sauce is delicious. It's rotisserie. Succulent and flavourful. You can get it in different spices. I like mild, I'm a bit of a heat wimp. You get a number of choices for sides, I always pick the corn. It's spicy and juicy. Yum.  You can get plain bread or garlic bread. You can't go wrong with either choice. The bread is soft and heart. I really like it. Salads are hearty and filling too.  The thing I love getting here is the chicken livers. You get a bowl of them they are spicy and are perfect paired with the bread.  They do a really big take out business. I'd say 90% of the orders while we were there were take out.  Conclusion:  It's great food for a fast food place. Reasonably priced too.  I think it literally has something for everyone.
